title: Developer Mechanical Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about fine mechanics and eager to make a real difference in people’s lives? Do you want to be part of a fast-growing, innovative company developing life-changing implantable hearing solutions?


At Oticon Medical, we’re on a mission to improve the quality of life for people with severe hearing loss. We’re now looking for a Mechanical Engineer to join our R&D team in Askim, Sweden. Bring your mechanical design expertise – we’ll bring the purpose, the passion, and the people.

 **What You’ll Do**

  

As a Mechanical Engineer, you’ll play a key role in developing our next-generation sound processors and implantable hearing systems. You’ll work in cross-functional teams alongside experts in R&D, Operations, Regulatory, Clinical, and Marketing.


Your responsibilities will include:

  

* Designing micro-mechanical components from concept to production
* CAD modeling (we use PTC Creo)
* Building and testing physical prototypes

Idea creation, design management and verification activities  
* 
* Optimizing designs for cost, performance, and manufacturability
* Managing design changes and updating technical documentation
* Ensuring compliance with medical device regulations and standards
* Document work in accordance with the company's development processes

 **What You Bring**

  

We’re looking for someone who is hands-on, structured, and thrives in a collaborative environment. You likely have:

  

* A BSc or MSc in Mechanical Engineering
* 3–5 years of experience in mechanical design, preferably in medical devices or other regulated industries
* Skills in CAD modeling (preferably Creo)
* Experience with fine mechanics and plastic components
* A proactive, solution-oriented mindset and documentation skills
* Fluency in English (spoken and written)

 **Why Join Us?**

  

* Be part of a purpose-driven company improving lives worldwide
* Work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment with a strong team spirit
* Collaborate with passionate colleagues across disciplines and borders
* Enjoy a flexible, supportive, and informal workplace culture

  

We believe the best results come from teamwork. We value knowledge sharing, open communication, and a positive attitude – especially when facing challenges.

 **How to Apply**

  

Submit your CV and application through our online system by 2025-11-23. We do not accept applications via email. Please note as well that the position might close before last application date, so don’t hesitate to apply.


For questions, contact Hanna Peters, Director, Implant Systems, at hass@oticonmedical.com.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
Relocasa (Lägenhetsbyte) is the world’s fastest-growing home swap service. For 20 years, it has been the go-to platform for Swedes looking to exchange rental apartments — and has now quickly established itself as a leading player in Denmark, Germany, and the Netherlands. Following a successful European launch, new markets await. To support this global expansion, we’re further developing and refining the service to meet the needs of users around the world. You could be a key part of that journey!
 




  




**About the role** 


 Relocasa is looking for a Senior Frontend Developer who not only wants to build a reliable and scalable product, but also contribute with new ideas, experiment with modern solutions, and be a driving force in shaping the future of our platform.
 





 As our new senior developer, you’ll have a high level of trust and freedom, and your expertise will play a central role in discussions about the company’s technical direction. You’ll be involved in the entire development process — continuously adding new features, improving technical architecture, optimizing performance, and adapting the product for local needs in international markets.
 




  




**Who you are** 


 You’re a self-driven problem solver who takes initiative and enjoys technical challenges. You probably have experience from scale-ups or smaller product-focused companies, where you’ve taken ownership and worked creatively to move the product forward.
 





 This is a role for someone who thrives in a collaborative, fast-moving environment — who wants to influence technical decisions, work closely with Product, UX, and other developers, and help take a successful scale-up to the next level.
 




  




**You will:** 
* Take ownership of the entire development process — from idea to release — and actively contribute with your own ideas and technical insights
* Have a key voice in shaping the company’s technical direction and architecture
* Optimize technical architecture and application performance
* Collaborate with developers and designers in continuous release cycles, driven by real user feedback



  




**You have:** 
* At least 5 years of experience in frontend development
* Experience building large, complex web applications
* Hands-on experience with modern JavaScript frameworks such as React or Vue
* Experience working with CI/CD pipelines and version control using Git
* Experience with mobile app development (React Native or similar)
* Solid understanding of component-based design and working with design systems
* Bonus: familiarity with accessibility standards (WCAG) and performance optimization





 ﻿
 




**What we offer** 


 Join a global growth journey in a successful product company, where your expertise truly makes an impact. Relocasa is entering an exciting new phase, and you’ll play a key role in shaping both technology and architecture. You’ll have the freedom to work creatively and build a product that makes a real difference for thousands of people. At Relocasa, you’ll help individuals successfully exchange homes in some of Europe’s most housing-constrained markets.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We at the iOS team** 
 , are a bunch of the crazy ones, the misfits, the rebels, the troublemakers. We ideate and build all of the Truecaller iOS app. Our vision is to take our love for Apple products and build a great iOS app with beauty, care & affection.
   

  

**As an iOS Engineer,** 
 you will have an impact on how our users use the iOS app, you will be working on the whole app from the authentication to the search feature and you will also work very closely with all the other teams in the company to achieve our company vision: enabling each person or business to maintain a secure and trusted online identity.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Design, develop, and maintain the company's iOS application
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of the app
* Debug complex technical issues and identify solutions to improve the app
* Stay up-to-date with new technologies and trends in iOS development
* Write clean, maintainable, and scalable code
* Participate in code reviews and ensure adherence to coding standards
* Contribute to the technical design and architecture of the app
* Participate in the full software development life cycle, including planning, development, testing, and deployment.


**What You Bring In**
* 3-5 years of overall experience with iOS development
* Advanced knowledge of programming using Swift
* Deep understanding and several years of hands-on experience in iOS application development (architectures, design, tools, SDKs), asynchronous server communication, and UX optimization
* Experience in agile development
* Fluent English skills, oral and written


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* SwiftUI experience
* Familiarity with automation tools like GitHub Actions and Fastlane


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget range.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
   

  

 Job info
   

  

 Location
   

  

**Stockholm, Sverige**
 Category
   

  

**iOS**
 Team
   

  

**iOS**
 Posted

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Eyevinn Technology** 
 is looking for an experienced
 **fullstack developer** 
 with a passion for
 **video and media technology** 
 .
 



  





**About the role** 




 You’ll work on a variety of projects across the video stack — from backend microservices and APIs to modern web interfaces. Our clients range from world-leading media companies to innovative startups. You’ll also get opportunities to contribute to open-source projects and share knowledge within the community.
 



  





**What we’re looking for** 



* Experienced fullstack developer.
* Strong skills in
 **Golang** 
 and/or
 **TypeScript** 
 .
* Experience with
 **microservice** 
 and
 **API** 
 development.
* Experience with
 **container deployments** 
 and
 **CI/CD workflows** 
 .
* You
 **use AI tools** 
 as part of your daily development workflow.
* Some experience in
 **UI development** 
 (not required, but a plus).
* Proficiency in
 **Swedish** 
 and
 **English** 
 .
* Collaborative, curious, and self-driven mindset.

 ,

 , or

 technologies.
* Background in

 ,
 **media tech**

 development.

 We’re an independent team of media experts who value

title: Back End Developer
description:
Want to work at a Tech Consultancy that is partnered with some of Sweden's biggest and best companies? Spotify, Klarna, Doktor24, WerLabs, DICE, King.. The list goes on.
 



  





 Some people are put off by the word "Consultancy", but why? Exposure to different and new environments / challenges, long term projects and the chance to keep developing.
 



  





 The difference here, they will ask you what you love doing in terms of technologies and products and then find a project that will thrill you.
 



  





 Now they're looking for a Senior Backend Developer to join the team.
 



  





**You'll be an ideal fit if you have:**




  




* Demonstrable knowledge in distributed backend development, preferably with Java, Node, Python, Go or C#
* The ability to design, develop and deploy backend services focusing on high availability, low latency and scalability
* The ability to operate at a strategic level within the organisation to address scalability issues
* Experience of working in hi-transactional environments, with an understanding of how physical resources i.e i/o, cpu memory affects software design
* Hands-on experience in developing microservices
* Be able to maintain and improve our data pipelines
* Best practices and patterns for modern API design
* Have a good understanding of internet protocols i.e UDP, TCP, HTTP



  





  





**Other details:** 




  





 Full time employment, no freelance option.
 



 60,000 SEK - 70,000k SEK p/m
 



 Hybrid Remote policy (1-3 days / week in the office - Stockholm)
 



 3x Stage interview process
 



  





 If you feel this role is you then apply ASAP and if suitable, someone from our team will be in touch.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
Relocasa (Lägenhetsbyte) is the world’s fastest-growing home swap service. For 20 years, it has been the go-to platform for Swedes looking to exchange rental apartments — and has now quickly established itself as a leading player in Denmark, Germany, and the Netherlands. Following a successful European launch, new markets await. To support this global expansion, we’re further developing and refining the service to meet the needs of users around the world. You could be a key part of that journey!
 




  




**About the role** 


 Relocasa is looking for a Senior Fullstack Developer who not only wants to build a reliable and scalable product, but also contribute with new ideas, experiment with modern solutions, and be a driving force in shaping the future of our platform.
 





 As our new senior developer, you’ll have a high level of trust and freedom, and your expertise will play a central role in discussions about the company’s technical direction. You’ll be involved in the entire development process — continuously adding new features, improving technical architecture, optimizing performance, and adapting the product for local needs in international markets.
 




  




**Who you are** 


 You’re a self-driven problem solver who takes initiative and enjoys technical challenges. You probably have experience from scale-ups or smaller product-focused companies, where you’ve taken ownership and worked creatively to move the product forward.
 





 This is a role for someone who thrives in a collaborative, fast-moving environment — who wants to influence technical decisions, work closely with Product, UX, and other developers, and help take a successful scale-up to the next level.
 




  




**You will:** 
* Take ownership of the entire development process — from idea to release — and actively contribute with your own ideas and technical insights
* Have a key voice in shaping the company’s technical direction and architecture
* Optimize technical architecture and application performance
* Collaborate with developers and designers in continuous release cycles, driven by real user feedback



  




**You have:** 
* At least 5 years of experience in software development
* Experience developing with Node.js (C#/.NET is a plus, as large parts of the current codebase are written in it)
* Knowledge of MSSQL and MySQL
* Hands-on experience with modern JavaScript frameworks such as React or Vue
* Experience working with CI/CD pipelines and version control using Git
* Understanding of secure coding practices and experience implementing and maintaining security standards in applications
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, as well as using Docker and microservices
* Experience with mobile app development (React Native or similar)





 ﻿
 




**What we offer** 


 Join a global growth journey in a successful product company, where your expertise truly makes an impact. Relocasa is entering an exciting new phase, and you’ll play a key role in shaping both technology and architecture. You’ll have the freedom to work creatively and build a product that makes a real difference for thousands of people. At Relocasa, you’ll help individuals successfully exchange homes in some of Europe’s most housing-constrained markets.

title: Full Stack Developer - Shaping the Future of Digital Banking | SEB, Solna
description:
**What You Will Be Doing**
 Do you want to contribute to modernizing our systems within the financing & loans area within SEB? Work in an area with many interesting initiatives ahead of us, work with modern technology and work in close cooperation with the business? Then this role is for you!
   

  

 Within Financing & Loans Channels Loans we work with development and maintenance of the bank's mortgage and consumer loans. We are responsible for systems supporting both internal and external customers to the bank. We continuously work with the development of self-service functions in mobile and internet banking. We are now looking for a senior full stack developer to one of the team.
   

  

**As a Developer You Vill Be Responsible For**
 In the team, you will work together with other developers, testers, scrum master and product owner. We are in a phase where we are developing the front part out integration into a common payment system across multiple banks. We work with API and container-based architecture. Our solutions are built with .NET Core, React and hosted on Docker. You will be one of the key players in this exciting journey, where we both maintain the current application while we need to move functionality and develop new functionality according to SEB´s target architecture.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
* Some years working with backend and frontend and preferably with .NET as backend language.
* Solid developer background combined with knowledge of Microservices, CI/CD and Docker.
* JavaScript and React experience is preferred.
* Hands-on experience with Pub/Sub (Kafka) and GCP is a plus.
* Updated regarding modern code guidelines and standards such as SOLID, DDD.
* Familiar with unit tests and test automation.
* We see that you are fluent in English in both speech and writing.


**What We Offer**
 We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
   

  

* Innovative company in forefront of technology.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Attractive compensation and benefits.
* Work-life balance.
* Friendly and welcoming culture.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial to our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.
   

  

**Ready to join?**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025-11-09. If you have questions about the position, please contact Waqas Butt, Manager Financing & Loans Channel Loans by mail Waqas.butt@seb.se.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes, for example, identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug tests.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

*Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.*
 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Software Engineer, Think
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European-owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 We’re seeking a talented Software Engineer to join our Think team, where you’ll build the robust, scalable backend systems that power our Think AI services platform. Think is our flagship AI inference service that allows users to deploy powerful AI models with European values built in – featuring simple APIs, transparent costs, and ensuring data stays exactly where users want it.
   

  

 A key focus of your role will be building scalable RESTful APIs in Go and orchestrating containerized workloads with Kubernetes – ensuring our AI services can scale efficiently while maintaining the highest standards of reliability and performance. You’ll work on solving complex challenges around API design, service orchestration, and resource management.
   

  

**What You’ll Tackle**
* Build and optimize API backend services using Go and Python
* Drive large-scale container orchestration with Kubernetes, ensuring scalability and reliability
* Design and manage APIs (REST and gRPC), including traffic management and gateway integration
* Apply distributed systems principles to deliver robust, fault-tolerant services
* Streamline delivery through CI/CD pipelines and DevOps best practices
* Collaborate in Git-based workflows, contributing to a high-velocity engineering culture


**Skills We Value**
* Strong proficiency in Go and/or Python
* Extensive experience with Kubernetes and container orchestration
* Solid understanding of API gateways, traffic management, and routing
* Experience designing and implementing RESTful APIs and gRPC services
* Knowledge of distributed systems principles and design patterns
* Proficiency in distributed systems and Linux systems engineering


 We offer a competitive salary and equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant energy of Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’ll enjoy an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture.
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background – ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture – is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: .NET Developer CRM
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Utvecklare på Sopra Steria – skapa framtidens lösningar med oss!**
 Hos oss på Sopra Steria arbetar du med alla delar av utvecklingsprocessen, från koncept till implementation och förvaltning. Du får bryta ner komplexa problem och skapa anpassade lösningar till kunder med den allra senaste tekniken, med grund i Microsofts hela portfölj av tjänster. Som utvecklare i .NET rör vi oss över hela stacken, vilket gör att arbetsuppgifterna under en vecka kan variera. Att arbeta med Microsofts paraply av molntjänster, som dessutom ständigt utökas, gör att du kan bli specialist inom ditt kompetensområde, men ändå alltid ha mer att lära.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna som utvecklare hos oss kan t.ex. innebära att:
   

  

* Anpassa funktionaliteten i Dynamics CRM genom utveckling av tillägg i C# och klientanpassningar i JavaScript/TypeScript
* Skapa .NET Core-applikationer för att integrera till och från Dynamics CRM
* Skapa low code-lösningar baserat på Power Apps och Power Automate
* Skapa förutsägbara och stabila releaser med verktyg som Azure DevOps, TeamCity, Octopus Deploy m.fl.


**Om dig**
 Vi söker både dig som har tidigare erfarenhet av .NET-utveckling inom Dynamics CE och dig som är erfaren .NET-utvecklare och nu vill bygga vidare på dina kunskaper!
   

  

*Antingen har du:*
* 3 års erfarenhet som utvecklare backend, C# .NET
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Power Apps, Power Automate, Dataverse, Azure eller andra kringliggande tjänster inom området
* God kommunikativ förmåga i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


*Eller:*
* 5+ års erfarenhet som utvecklare backend, C# .NET
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult
* God kommunikativ förmåga i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


**Varför välja Sopra Steria**
* Fokus på kompetensutveckling och din personliga utveckling - vi kallar det för Power of sharing
* Stark företagskultur - utsedda till Sveriges bästa arbetsplats av Great Place to Work
* Många teamleveranser!


**Ansök nu – vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!**
 Vi behandlar ansökningar och kallar till intervju löpande. På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen består av tre intervjuer, ett logiskt test, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll. Denna kombination av urvalsmetoder ger oss en bredare och mer rättvis bild av dig som kandidat, samtidigt som det säkerställer att både dina tekniska och personliga styrkor kommer till sin rätt. För dig som kandidat innebär det en möjlighet att visa din kompetens och potential från flera perspektiv.
   

  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller oss som bolag är du välkommen att kontakta Victoria på v.stjernstroem@soprasteria.com
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Software Engineer - Zalando Logistics Technology (ZEOS) - All Genders
description:
Over the last years, we learned that solving fulfilment related challenges for the good of our customers helps us to fuel the growth of our platform. With more partners in Partner Program and Connected Retail joining our platform, we have been developing and testing additional fulfilment services tailored to their needs.
   

  

 The ZEOS Logistics department is responsible for all partner-facing Zalando Logistics Solutions. By unifying and collaborating these services under a single umbrella, we provide a more holistic approach to delivering the optimal fulfilment solution to meet our partners' needs and leverage common services to enable partner program growth.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer in ZEOS Logistics, you will develop and operate business-critical applications for our partners and internal stakeholders that process tens of thousands of events per second powering the critical partner-facing backend APIs and web applications of the partner fulfilment domain. You will work with tools and technologies such as Java, Kotlin, PostgreSQL, AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch in building high-performance, low-latency systems to create an impact on customers and partners.
   

  

**INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN**
 At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.
   

  

 We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.
   

  

 do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy
   

  

 https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion
   

  

 Our employee resource groups
   

  

 https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)...**
* Build and operate large-scale data streaming and processing applications serving fulfilment process relevant data with the latency of tens of milliseconds in magnitude to Zalando partners in using technologies such as Java, Kotlin, Postgres, and Elasticsearch.
* Use a state-of-the-art software development methodology.
* Be part of a newly established engineering team in Stockholm and help to foster an environment of continuous learning.


**WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF..** 
 .
   

  

  

* 5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer in developing APIs and high-volume data streaming and processing systems with either Java or Kotlin.
* Initial hands-on experience with SQL storage technologies.
* Familiarity with AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch is in addition a plus.
* "You build it, you run it" approach you have had a first experience in managing services end-to-end, from developing to deploying to monitoring and incident support is a big plus.
* Passion for working in an agile, cross-functional team, iterating quickly during the product development cycle. As well as, ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with business stakeholders, product managers, and engineering peers.


**OUR OFFER**
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

**About Zalando**
 It’s the perfect time to join Zalando on our journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to the starting point for fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 23 markets.
   

  

 Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to almost 49 million active customers through a team of diverse skill-sets, cultural backgrounds, and interests.
   

  

 Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset
   

  

 do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/sustainability Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando
   

  

 Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

title: Join the Funnel Talent Pool — Product, Dev & Design
description:
At Funnel, we're building the future of data-driven marketing and that takes an exceptional team. While we may not have your
 *exact* 
 dream role open today, we’re always looking for brilliant minds to join us in the future.
   

  

 Whether You're a Designer, Developer Or Product Manager, We’d Love To Connect. By Joining Our Talent Pool, You’ll Be The First To Know When Opportunities That Match Your Background And Passion Open Up In Our
   

  

**Development team**
 Craft scalable, high-performance systems with a clean and modern tech stack - Typescript/Javascript, React, Node, Rust, Python and AWS.
   

  

 We love great architecture, elegant code, and a culture of collaboration and continuous learning.
   

  

**Product team**
 Drive clarity in complexity. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and shape a product that solves real-world problems for marketers around the world.
   

  

****Design team****
 Create intuitive, elegant, and empowering experiences. From UX research to UI design, our designers shape the way people interact with data every day.
   

  

*Please note: all Product, Dev and Design teams are based in office in Stockholm, Sweden.*
******What We Value******
* Curiosity: You ask why. And then ask it again.
* Autonomy: You don’t wait for permission to solve a problem.
* Collaboration: You thrive on working closely with others.
* Impact: You want your work to matter- to your team, our users, and the business.


******Why Funnel?******
* 🌍 International team with a strong in office culture
* 👥 Friendly, smart and welcoming people
* 🛠️ Modern tech, continuous delivery, and true product ownership
* 💚 Inclusive, supportive culture that invests in people
* 🧘 Generous time off, team offsites, and wellness benefits


******Learn more about Funnel!******
* Who are we - a founder’s story
* Product development at Funnel - ways of working
* Why we built a data ingestion platform - unique problems we’re solving


 Interested?
   

  

 Let’s not wait for the perfect job ad to get to know each other. Apply to our Talent Pool with your CV or LinkedIn profile and tell us what position/s you would be interested in and what kind of work you enjoy doing.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Software Engineer, Storage
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 As a Software Engineer on the evroc Storage team, you will help lay the foundations of highly performant and scalable cloud storage solutions operating at mission-critical levels of availability and durability. You will be involved in all phases of the product lifecycle including design, architecture, development, deployment and maintenance.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Design, develop and maintain evroc’s cloud storage offerings including S3 object storage, block storage and shared file systems.
* Build components using first principles from the ground up to unlock optimization opportunities at every layer of the stack.
* Optimize existing cloud storage solutions for performance ensuring low latency and high throughput, high reliability and cost effectiveness.
* Work with appropriate stakeholders to determine user requirements. Leverage a variety of feedback channels to incorporate insights into future designs or solution fixes.
* Seamlessly integrate and upkeep open-source components within our evolving tech stack. Team up with fellow engineers to craft tailored solutions meeting our unique challenges.
* Lead the charge in defining and achieving our technical benchmarks.


**Skills We Value**
* Proficiency in distributed systems and Linux systems engineering.
* Coding in programming languages such as C, C++, Golang or Rust.
* Typically 5+ years of experience in building and enhancing clustered storage solutions such as Ceph, Gluster, HDFS, Lustre or MinIO or cloud storage such as AWS S3, EBS, GCP’s Blob/Block/File Storage.
* Extensive experience within the Kubernetes ecosystem developing and running highly available services. Helm, Kustomize, Knative, Rook and controller runtime knowledge is a plus.
* Deep understanding of databases, file systems and storage protocols. (Bonus) experience in Solid-State Drive (SSD)/NAND or Hard Disk Drive (HDD) based storage technologies, interfaces (e.g., NVMe, SATA/SAS), and security standards (TCG).
* Knowledge of performance tuning and optimization techniques.
* Active engagement or contributions to the open-source community.
* Collaborative, curious, and pragmatic Software Engineer who wants to be part of an innovative team.


 Please note you do not need to have experience with all of the technologies listed above to apply. If your background is in storage technologies and distributed systems, and you are passionate about building a better cloud, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Javautvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete med dokumenterad javarelaterad lösningsarkitektur under de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av java-baserad backend-utveckling baserad på JavaEE eller Spring Boot/Framework under de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet som Lead developer eller motsvarande inom Java under de senaste 5 åren.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av utveckling i containerbaserade miljöer (Kubernetes eller OpenShift) senaste 5 åren.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av utveckling med Angular senaste 5 åren.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av java-baserad integration (synkron och asynkron) och persistenslager (JPA) under de senaste 5 åren.
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet som Lead developer eller motsvarande inom Java under de senaste 5 åren.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av utvecklingsarbete inom en stor myndighet
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Angular samt Web Logic Server


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 27-10-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world's #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We at the iOS team** 
 , are a bunch of the crazy ones, the misfits, the rebels, the troublemakers. We ideate and build all of the Truecaller iOS app. Our vision is to take our love for Apple products and build a great iOS app with beauty, care & affection.
   

  

**As a Senior iOS Engineer,** 
 you will have an impact on how our users use the iOS app, you will be working on the whole app from the authentication to the search feature and you will also work very closely with all the other teams in the company to achieve our company vision: enabling each person or business to maintain a secure and trusted online identity.
   

  

**The impact you will create:**
* Design, develop, and maintain the company's iOS application
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of the app
* Debug complex technical issues and identify solutions to improve the app
* Stay up-to-date with new technologies and trends in iOS development
* Write clean, maintainable, and scalable code
* Participate in code reviews and ensure adherence to coding standards
* Contribute to the technical design and architecture of the app
* Participate in the full software development life cycle, including planning, development, testing, and deployment.


**What you bring in:**
* 5+ years of overall experience with iOS development
* Advanced knowledge of programming using Swift
* Deep understanding and several years of hands-on experience in iOS application development (architectures, design, tools, SDKs), asynchronous server communication, and UX optimization
* Experience in debugging and troubleshooting complex systems
* Leading, planning, and executing the development of core features and modules for iOS applications
* Ability to navigate and research requirements in the scope of a big cross-functional team
* Ability to dive into complicated, unique problems, find a clear path forward, and drive the work to a successful conclusion.
* Experience in agile development
* Fluent English skills, oral and written


**It would be great if you also have:**
* SwiftUI experience
* Familiarity with automation tools like GitHub Actions and Fastlane
* Experience with mentoring and onboarding junior team members


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What we offer:**
* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget range.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There's something for everyone!


**Come as you are:**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that's why we would love to meet you.

title: C/C++ Developer for high speed test tool project
description:
Assignment Description
   

  

 The goal of this interesting agile project is to deliver a telecom high speed test tool to the customer organization.
   

  

 The team works developing the tool within several technical fields of expertise ranging from embedded SW, FPGA, application SW, lab work and more. Team member competencies complement each other to create a strong team where we all learn and collaborate.
   

  

**Project:**
* Bleeding edge technology
* Inhouse project but closely collaborating- and integrated with customer “Swedish telecom giant”
* Remote from Sweden possible (Hybrid workplace is standard)
* Multi-site delivery with colleagues both in Solna and abroad sites
* Important values are: inclusivity, team spirit, collaborative mindset


**Who are you?**
* Good team player
* Good English skills
* We welcome applicants with all backgrounds and genders!


**Mandatory:**
* Product development in C/C++
* Testing in C#
* Version control using Git (Gerrit meriting)
* Agile experience


**Meriting/Bonus:**
* Comfortable with some customer contact
* Automation in Jenkins
* OpenEmbedded/Yocto development for Linux
* IPv6/DHCPv6 networking
* Telecom experience


 Other relevant information
   

  

* Occasional travel to the office in Solna will occur
* CET Office hours
* Remote from Sweden is possible


 Desired competence
   

  

 Electronics System and Communication technology, Software Engineering and Test, Software developer, C/C++
   

  

**Application Deadline:** 
 2025-10-25
   

  

**Duration:** 
 1 Year or more

title: CRM Developer, Salesforce focus
description:
**Solve real business problems by building and scaling CRMs and applying AI into digital strategy. We are looking for you who want to work in cross-functional teams, have autonomy in your work and build our CRM offering together with us. Let's find your Road!**
 Who we are
   

  

 We are Columbia Road, a Nordic digital sales consultancy dedicated to transforming how companies grow. We create scalable, data-driven solutions with customer experience at the core. By combining CRM expertise, modern data platforms, and AI-enabled marketing and sales, we help our clients orchestrate personalised customer journeys, automate at scale, and deliver measurable commercial impact.
   

  

 Our clients include ambitious B2B and B2C companies — from global consumer brands to leading industrial players. We work at the intersection of technology, design, and business, solving complex challenges and building solutions that drive sustainable growth.
   

  

 At Columbia Road, you’ll join a flat and entrepreneurial organisation with the freedom to lead, challenge, and shape both your own career and our growing presence in Sweden. You will join a small ambitious team in Sweden and be a part of a group of hundreds of experts in the nordics.
   

  

 The job & what you’d be working on
   

  

 We are strengthening our Salesforce and CRM capabilities in Stockholm and looking for experienced consultants who want to play a key role in both client success and our local growth journey.
   

  

 As a CRM / Salesforce Developer at Columbia Road, you will:
   

  

* Build and scale CRM solutions (preferably Salesforce) that unlock data-driven insights and improved customer experiences within sales, marketing and service.
* Act as a trusted advisor to clients — helping them connect business strategy with technology, improve sales processes, and identify opportunities for automation and AI.
* Contribute to developing new commercial opportunities, building networks, and growing our presence in Sweden.
* Work in cross-functional teams with consultants, designers, and developers to deliver real business impact.


 This is a senior role suited to someone who enjoys combining technical expertise with business acumen, and who is curious about the potential of AI and intelligent agents in transforming sales and marketing.
   

  

**Skills And Experience We Expect You To Have**
* Hunger to drive change and create business value
* Solid hands-on experience with CRM, preferably Salesforce (Sales, Service, Marketing, Experience and Data Clouds).
* Ability to connect business requirements with technical solutions — turning data into insights and scalable processes.
* Experience with integrations between CRM and other business systems (ERP, marketing automation, data platforms).
* Knowledge of data modelling and customer data architecture to enable scalable solutions.
* Curiosity around AI and automation in marketing and sales.
* Proven consulting skills: problem-solving, communication, and client management.
* Track record in developing commercial relationships and contributing to business growth.
* Fluency in Swedish and English (professional level).


**The Following Are Considered An Advantage**
* Agency or consultancy experience
* Familiarity with marketing automation tools (e.g. Marketing Cloud, Pardot).
* Salesforce development skills (Lightning, APEX, Visualforce) and architectural understanding.


 Why join us
   

  

* Work with the best: Collaborate with top CRM (in addition to Salesforce), data, design, and tech experts across the Nordics.
* Get to solve real business problems (not just implementing solutions), applying AI into digital strategy, implementation and operations.
* Freedom to lead: Shape projects, influence decisions, and build our Salesforce practice in Sweden.
* Competitive package: Salary, benefits, flexible work, and a modern office in central Stockholm.
* Never stop learning: Support for Salesforce certifications and growth towards roles like Salesforce Architect or Team Lead.
* Culture that connects: Regular team events, offsites, and a strong Nordic community that values collaboration and fun.


 Recruitment process
   

  

 Our recruitment process typically involves 2-3 interviews where we learn about your skills and what motivates you. You'll discover more about Columbia Road and meet various Roadies along the way. After our discussions, we'll reach out to your chosen references. We look forward to hearing from you soon!
   

  

**Benefits**
* A community-led organisation with a high level of autonomy
* A diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace
* Option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share program
* A yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)
* Recurring training and learning sessions to support your professional growth
* Offices in central Stockholm, Drottninggatan 33, with daily breakfast & snacks
* A wide selection of quality tools to use for your work (laptop, phone etc.) and a mobile phone subscription
* Health services incl. mental health, and insurance
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Recurring Roadie-ideated events and activities
* Compensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time


 We help companies sell better by building seamless digital solutions and running concrete growth activities. Find your Road with us by exploring open jobs or Connecting with us!

title: Senior Backend Engineer (TypeScript) [Prisma Postgres]
description:
At Prisma, we’re redefining how developers work with databases. If you’re fascinated by the cutting-edge data infrastructure powering companies like Twitter, Airbnb, and Facebook, but want the agility, ownership, and impact of a fast-moving startup, Prisma is the place for you.
   

  

 Backed by top-tier Silicon Valley investors like Amplify Partners, Kleiner Perkins, and IVP, our small, distributed team is making advanced database technology accessible to developers everywhere. Our open-source tools are trusted by over 400,000 developers each month, with a thriving community on Discord and GitHub, where we’ve earned 43,000+ GitHub Stars.
   

  

 At the heart of our commercial offerings is Prisma Postgres, our flagship product designed to supercharge PostgreSQL with modern developer workflows, performance optimizations, and seamless scaling. Alongside it, Prisma Accelerate, and Studio, provide a world-class tookit for building with data.
   

  

 By combining the power of open-source with cutting-edge commercial solutions, we’re shaping the future of databases, one developer at a time.
   

  

 What would you do at Prisma?
   

  

 You’ll be part of our Prisma Data Platform team which is responsible for Accelerate, Prisma Postgres and the bare metal cloud that those products are build on. You'll be contributing across the stack to the projects of the team.
   

  

 To Give You a Clear Idea Of What The Job Could Entail, Here Are Some Examples Of The Work We’ve Done Lately Or Will Start Soon
   

  

* Design, implement and deploy a websocket server that will allow customers to connect to Prisma Postgres from WASM environments where TCP connections are unavailable.
* Work closely with the ORM team to define the protocol of that server so they can implement the client adapter.
* Choose and deploy a globally distributed configuration store (like etcd, rqlite) for encrypted authentication secrets to enable global routing for Prisma Postgres.
* Work together with an infra engineer to improve automation of our bare metal servers with the goal to reduce the provisioning time of new servers.
* Troubleshoot and fix a bug where a customer experiences sporadic connectivity issues.


 An Ideal Candidate Profile
   

  

 We believe the right candidate for this position should meet a majority of the criteria listed below.
   

  

* 8+ Years experience in agile software engineering teams, delivering robust web applications, using TypeScript, NodeJS and golang.
* Experience in building and scaling distributed systems. Experience with bare metal servers is a plus.
* Experience in database and backend technologies like SQL/NoSQL databases and familiarity with cloud services, APIs (GraphQL/REST).
* High standards for quality, ensuring excellence while balancing pragmatism, purpose, and a strong sense of agency—taking ownership, making thoughtful trade-offs, and driving meaningful impact.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal—able to articulate complex ideas clearly, adapt messaging to different audiences, give and receive constructive feedback effectively, and foster collaboration across teams.
* You have a structured thought process, approaching problems methodically and making well-reasoned decisions. You plan effectively, setting clear goals, anticipating challenges, and ensuring smooth execution while keeping stakeholders aligned.


 What's it like to work at Prisma?
   

  

 You're likely to be a great fit for the team if you ...
   

  

* ... have an ownership mindset. As an Engineering Manager leading the ORM team, you'll have an outsized impact on decisions and the way things are executed.
* ... stay nimble. It's a startup, things change and you are ok with that. Be ready to re-calibrate often and stay flexible.
* ... be kind and collaborative. Come in ready to share your ideas and listen to feedback.


 What's in it for you?
   

  

 We put our people first\*\*.\*\* Strong pay, full flexibility, and benefits that make a difference. Take the time off that you need, grow your career, and do work that matters.
   

  

* An opportunity to lead the team shaping Prisma’s cutting-edge cloud products, driving innovation in modern database tooling and redefining how developers build and scale applications — see what we’re building.
* A Fun and Supportive Team that values collaboration, growth, and continuous learning.
* Competitive Base Salary and Stock Options, including extended post-termination exercise windows.
* Fully Remote Work with flexibility to work from anywhere within our required time zones. If you prefer an office environment, we provide access to a local co-working space for up to ten days per month.
* Generous Time Off, including twenty-four days of paid vacation and paid sick leave.
* Parental Benefits, including twenty weeks of fully paid parental leave and child sick leave.
* Sabbatical Leave, with six weeks of fully paid time off after three years of continuous employment.
* Mental Health Support, including four fully paid Mental Health Days per year and access to professional resources.
* Tech and Ergonomic Budget to equip you with the tools you need, plus an ergonomic chair subsidy for your comfort and well-being.
* Annual Offsites, bringing the team together twice a year with all expenses paid retreats at exciting locations.
* Relocation Support, offering a relocation package for team members moving to Berlin after twelve months, if you choose to relocate.
* [US] Health and Pension Benefits, including comprehensive health, dental, vision, and 401k matching.


 Remote Work
   

  

 To ensure effective collaboration we can currently only accept candidates within the timezone
 ****GMT -2 to GMT +3****
 for this position.
   

  

 What is our hiring process like?
   

  

* Introductory Call with our future manager.
* Take Home Assignment followed by a debrief call
* System Design Interview with one of your peer engineers
* Interview with our Head of Engineering
* Final Interview \*\*with our CEO / COO.
* Offer


 The above serves as a basic outline, we might choose to add or remove steps based on the information that we gather during the process.
   

  

 If you believe that this is the right position for you then please send your resume along with any supporting documentation or information to us via the link provided on this page. We typically respond within 7 business days.
   

  

 In line with our
 **Fair Treatment and Equal Opportunity Policy**
 , as well as our
 **Disability Policy**
 , Prisma follows fair and merit-based hiring practices, ensuring all candidates are evaluated based on their skills, experience, and qualifications. We do not make hiring decisions based on
 **age**
 ,
 **race**
 ,
 **ethnicity, sex, gender identity, parental or caregiver status, trade union membership, disability, religious belief or lack of belief, life expectancy, sexual orientation, genetic information**
 , or
 **veteran or military status.**

title: Android Developer, Retail App, Solna/Hybrid
description:
We are building the essential Retail solutions used at thousands of servicepoints across the Nordics. By providing our network partners with the most intuitive and reliable tools on the market, we play an integral role in PostNord’s growth.
   

  

 Through user-centric mobile applications and serverless architecture, we enable millions of customer interactions every year. Our team proudly takes the lead on developing creative and scalable solutions to re-shape the user experience at our physical locations. We are now looking for an Android developer to join us on this journey!
   

  

 You are an Android developer with a passion for teamwork. While striving for optimisation and simplification, you tackle complex business requirements with technical practises and problem-solving skills.
   

  

 By leading with humility and curiosity, you also empower your fellow team members in their own technical development. You are used to the challenges that modern computing platforms bring such as asynchronous programming and are comfortable with the reactive programming paradigm.
   

  

* BSc degree in Engineering and minimum 3 years of work experience in Mobile development
* Significant experience programming for the Android platform, using Java and/or Kotlin
* Some experience in Jetpack Compose


**We offer you**
**Responsibilities**
 We offer a variety of work and a lot of freedom and empowerment in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities and freedom to develop creative solutions and you will be able to switch responsibilities within the team as you see fit for your and the teams’ qualities and experiences. You will be hired by PostNord Sweden which is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of whether we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 What are you waiting for? Send in your application! Due to the summer holiday period, responses and follow-ups may take a bit longer than usual. We will be back after the vacation in August and look forward to reconnecting with you then. If you have any questions, feel free to contact manager malin.rydman@postnord.com.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Scada Developer, Oskarshamn
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are looking for a Scada developer to join our team! We are responsible for developing one of our customers' Scada systems on site at the customer who is active in the manufacturing industry and now needs to expand our Scada team.
   

  

 We are now looking for an automation engineer with a focus on Siemens TIA Portal and the Scada system Ignition. You will be involved in the development and implementation of a new Scada system based on Ignition, among other things. You will also work on adapting the PLC system. The tasks will vary between development, adaptation, commissioning, standby and possibly also readiness for the intended applications.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Several years of documented experience in industrial automation.
* Good knowledge of Siemens TIA Portal and the Scada system Ignition.
* Knowledge of Ignition, Python and database management, such as SQL databases.
* Experience with PLC programming in the Siemens TIA Portal or Allen Bradley systems is a requirement.
* Very good knowledge of Swedish and English, both spoken and written, as this occurs at our client.


****Location:****
 Oskarshamn, Sweden\Kalmar County
   

  

**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Junior Fullstack Utvecklare
description:
Vi söker en fullstack-utvecklare som är relativt tidig i karriären men som har drivet att lära sig snabbt och ta eget ansvar. Du behöver inte kunna allt från dag ett – men du måste vara den som inte ger upp när något är nytt eller utmanande.
 



  





 Du är:
 


* Självgående – Vi är ett litet team på två personer, så du behöver kunna driva dina egna uppgifter framåt och våga ta initiativ
* Problemlösare – Du är van att söka information, testa lösningar och hitta vägen framåt själv
* Kommunikativ – Du kommer arbeta nära våra kunder och behöver kunna förstå deras behov och översätta dem till fungerande lösningar



  





 Tekniskt behöver du ha:
 


* Solid grund – HTML, CSS och JavaScript ska du behärska väl
* Erfarenhet av webbapplikationer – Du har byggt något tidigare, antingen genom studier, projekt eller tidigare roller
* Förståelse för systemdesign – Du kan tänka i helhetslösningar och förstå hur olika delar av en applikation hänger ihop
* Inlärningsförmåga – Det viktigaste är att du snabbt kan sätta dig in i ny teknik och olika stackar



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Erfarenhet av DevOps eller AWS
* Öga för design och användargränssnitt
* Tidigare erfarenhet av kundarbete eller konsultuppdrag



  





 Vad innebär rollen?
 



 Vi är ett konsultbolag där du kommer att arbeta både på befintliga applikationer och nya projekt som våra kunder initierar.
 



  





 Du kommer behöva:
 


* Arbeta kundnära – Du kommunicerar direkt med kunder för att förstå deras behov och leverera lösningar
* Hantera fullstack-utveckling – Du arbetar både med frontend och backend i varje projekt
* Bygga robusta system – Vi värdesätter kod och arkitektur som håller över tid och kan skalas
* Vara flexibel – Du växlar mellan olika projekt och anpassar dig till varierande tekniska krav
* Ta eget ansvar – Vi samarbetar när det behövs, men du driver dina uppgifter självständigt och kan starta upp egna produkter



  





 Vad arbetar vi med?
 



 Vi bygger webbapplikationer och olika system, projekten varierar i omfattning men kräver alltid stabila lösningar med fokus på användarupplevelse och prestanda.
 



  





 Vår tekniska miljö:
 


* Frontend: React
* Backend: Node.js, Express, Next.js
* Databaser: MySQL/MariaDB
* Språk: TypeScript och JavaScript
* Infrastruktur: AWS (EC2, S3, ECS), Git, REST APIs

title: Frontend Developer - Books
description:
Hej, jag heter Niklas och är CTO på BookBeat. Roligt att just du är intresserad av att koda med oss! Jag söker nu dig som Frontend-utvecklare till vårt Books team.
 



  





 Jag tror att du har mellan 4-15 års erfarenhet av webbutveckling och om du har en universitetsexamen i ryggen är det meriterande. Du har en passion för att bygga en bra produkt och är engagerad i att skapa mjukvara på högsta nivå. Gissningsvis har du också en stark vilja att lära dig och öka din kompetens, samt att dela med dig av din kunskap till andra.
 



  





 I Books Developer teamet kommer du befinna dig i skärningen mellan BookBeat, våra användare i appen och förlagen. Vi bygger allt ifrån visuell analys av böckernas prestanda, interna gränssnitt för att styra innehållet i appen och visa böcker på bookbeat.com. Det gör att du behöver kunna växla mellan att optimera för användare och utvecklarhastighet beroende på plattform.
 



  





 Med över 1 miljon aktiva användare och lika många böcker i 30 länder är lasten allt annat än trivial, vilket ställer stora krav på prestanda och skalbarhet. Det gör arbetet väldigt omväxlande och utmanande.
 



  





 I korthet kan man beskriva BookBeats kultur som startup-lik med få inslag av "corporate" även om det till viss del behövs med 160 anställda. Ekonomiskt står vi på egna ben och är lönsamma med Bonnier som ägare.
 



  





 Jag vill att du är väldigt nyfiken, inte bara på teknik och kod, utan även på hur och varför saker görs. Det kan handla om allt från teknik och domän till människor, team och organisation. Du förstår att det är helheten som spelar roll i slutändan.
 



 Du inser vikten av att vara öppen för nya idéer och att dela med dig av dina kunskaper med andra utvecklare och specialister för att både BookBeat och du själv ska kunna utvecklas.
 



  





 Jag tror också att du är engagerad i det du gör och i ditt yrke; du bryr dig på riktigt om det som du och ditt team skickar till produktion och vilken effekt det ger.
 



  





 Tillsammans är vårt gemensamma mål på BookBeat att bygga Europas bästa tjänst för att hitta och uppleva digitala böcker.
 



  





 Du kommer, tillsammans med resten av utvecklingsteamen på BookBeat, att ha en viktig roll i hur vi skapar den bästa möjliga upplevelsen för våra över 1 miljon kunder och oss själva.
 



  





 Vårt kontor ligger på Sveavägen 56, rätt nära Webhallen.
 



  





 Språkmässigt har du goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
 



  





**Rollen innebär bland annat att:** 



* Skriva kod
* Tillsammans med teamet ansvara för att den tekniska plattformen håller hög kvalitet
* Arbeta med features från idé till färdig produkt
* Agera mentor och dela med dig av din kunskap
* Se till att
 
 den tekniska plattformen är tillgänglig och presterar på topp



  





**Jag tror du är grym på:** 



* React
* TypeScript
* Next.js
* CSS
* Testning (unit och e2e)



  





**Det är meriterande om du dessutom har erfarenhet av:** 



* Humor
* Accessibility
* Cloud (Azure/k8s)
* CI/CD
* Tracking, analytics och A/B-testning



  





 Om du är intresserad—skicka in din ansökan och berätta om din erfarenhet och varför du är rätt kandidat för oss! Vid frågor är du välkommen att höra av dig till mig, Niklas Arbin, på niklas.arbin@bookbeat.com.
 



  





**Som anställd på BookBeat AB erbjuds du ett förmånspaket som inkluderar:** 




 🌴 30 dagar semester per år
 



 💰 ITP1-tjänstepension
 



 💌 TGL (tjänstegrupplivförsäkring), TFA (trygghetsförsäkring vid arbetsskada) & tjänstereseförsäkring
 



 🎾 Årligt friskvårdsbidrag
 



 🤸 ♂️ Veckovis friskvårdstimme
 



 💻 Arbetsutrustning (dator och telefon) samt abonnemang
 



 🎧 BookBeat prenumeration
 



 🏥Företagshälsovård för att säkerställa ditt välmående
 



 👶Föräldraledighetsförmån för att stödja din växande familj
 



 📃Kollektivavtal
 



  





**Utöver våra förmåner erbjuder vi dig också:** 




 💜 En stabil och hållbar balans mellan arbete och fritid med en arbetsvecka på 37,9 timmar
 



 🏢 Ett kontor i centrala Stockholm
 



 🏃 ♀️ Gissa vad? På vårt Stockholmskontor har vi också tillgång till ett nyrenoverat gym med bastu!
 



 🏡 Flexibilitet i form av t.ex. flexibla arbetstider och vår policy för hybridarbete
 



 🚀 Möjligheten att växa i din roll och karriär, inklusive utmanande och lärorika arbetsuppgifter samt andra möjligheter till utveckling
 



 ✨ Roliga aktiviteter med kollegor! På BookBeat får du ta del av veckovisa "Friday afternoon mingles", månatliga företagsfrukostar och andra härliga arbetsrelaterade aktiviteter regelbundet tillsammans med hela företaget
 



 🧪 Möjligheten att utforska projekt du inte har tid för i ditt dagliga arbete under våra Hack Days
 



 🧠 Kunskapsdelningsmöjligheter, exempelvis under våra veckovisa "Friday demos" tillsammans med hela företaget där olika team delar vad de har jobbat på, jobbar på eller kommer jobba på. Kunskapsdelning är också en viktig del av vårt dagliga arbete!
 



 🤛 (Sist men inte minst) ett härligt och kompetent team och chef som kommer stötta dig genom din anställning!
 



  





**Om oss** 




 År 2015 påbörjade vi vår resa mot målet att erbjuda Europas ledande tjänst för digitala böcker, och 2016 lanserade vi till allmänheten. Nu, snart 9 år efter vår breda lansering, används BookBeat av över 1 miljon användare varje månad. Vi är ett ständigt växande företag inom Bonnierkoncernen och alla medlemmar som är del av vår resa har möjlighet att påverka vår utveckling – både på kort och lång sikt.
 



  





 Idag består Team BookBeat av 160 nyfikna och engagerade "doers". Är du intresserad av att bli en del av vårt team? Underbart! Våra anställda är experter på många olika områden, men vi har fyra kärnvärderingar som enar oss alla:
 



  





 🚀 Var fantastisk på det du gör
 



 📣 Dela det du vet och kan
 



 🔎 Nyfikenhet för våra användare och oss
 



 🤝 Bygg Team BookBeat
 



  





 Med andra ord: vi vill att våra medarbetare kontinuerligt ska djupdyka i och utvecklas inom sina kompetensområden, men också att de delar den kunskapen med sina kollegor – vi är alla del av Team BookBeat och samarbetar (oftast mycket) dagligen! Vi söker också medarbetare som är genuint nyfikna på våra användare samt på vår resa och organisation, en nyfikenhet som driver oss till att alltid testa nya saker i vår tjänst och att låta våra användare visa oss om vi är på rätt väg. Sist men definitivt inte minst vill vi att våra anställda ska bidra till Team BookBeats vardagliga samarbete och välmående – som redan nämnt är vi alla del av ett större team, ett team som vi vill ska må bra och ha kul på jobbet, något vi alla bidrar till på olika sätt.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Älskar du att vara i flödet som utvecklare – och vill skapa förutsättningar för att andra ska kunna göra detsamma? Brinner du för att bygga moderna utvecklingsmiljöer med hög prestanda, bra integrationer och effektiva verktyg? Vi söker en
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 som vill vara med och forma nästa generations infrastruktur och utvecklarupplevelse.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
 I rollen kommer du att arbeta med att utveckla och förbättra den tekniska plattformen som används. Fokus ligger på att skapa
 **enhetliga, skalbara och effektiva utvecklingsverktyg** 
 som gör det enkelt att bygga, testa och leverera mjukvara i stor skala.
   

  

 Du kommer att bidra till både
 **backend- och frontendutveckling** 
 , där
 **Java** 
 ,
 **TypeScript** 
 och
 **React** 
 står i centrum. Arbetet innefattar att utveckla och förvalta interna verktyg och applikationer som förenklar utvecklarnas vardag, förbättrar byggprocesser och automatiserar repetitiva moment.
   

  

**Kompetenskrav:**
* Du har en stark passion för utvecklarproduktivitet och moderna utvecklingsverktyg.
* Du har djup erfarenhet av Java för backendutveckling och React/TypeScript för frontend.
* Du är van vid att arbeta med storskaliga kodbaser och har förståelse för bygg- och deployprocesser.
* Du trivs med att samarbeta i tvärfunktionella team och bidra till en kultur av delning och lärande.
* Du är en nyfiken problemlösare med fokus på kvalitet och långsiktighet.


**💚 Humanit**
 Humanit handlar om att göra saker lite annorlunda, att på riktigt sätta våra anställda i fokus. Vi växer tillsammans och värdesätter engagemang och ambition. För oss är det viktigt att du får chansen att vara med och påverka vägen framåt.
   

  

 I utbyte erbjuder vi kompetens- och karriärutveckling genom varierande och utmanande uppdrag. Vi är inte branschinriktade och kan därför erbjuda en fantastisk variation bland uppdragen för dig som konsult. Självklart ser vi till att du får rätt utbildning och vi är väl medvetna om att det är det livslånga lärandet som bygger vår framgång.
   

  

 Tillsammans skapar vi framtiden 🚀
   

  

* Tillsvidareanställning med fast månadslön
* Kollektivavtal
* Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning, inklusive maxat friskvårdsbidrag
* Utvecklingsplan
* Hälsoförsäkring + pension
* Förskottssemester


**Start** 
 : Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid och när säkerhetskontroll är genomförd. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare.
   

  

**Plats** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

**Ansökan** 
 : Vi rekryterar löpande. Så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

*Humanit arbetar tillsammans med Great Place To Work för att vi skall bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats.*
**Och förresten:**
*Som en aktiv del i ett samhälle med kulturell och social mångfald är Humanit’s ambition att präglas av inkludering och bred representation, samt vara en arbetsplats med lika möjligheter för alla. Humanit anställer, bibehåller, befordrar och i övrigt behandlar alla medarbetare och kandidater efter erfarenhet, kvalifikationer och kompetens, oavsett kön, religion, ursprung, ålder, sexuell läggning, könsidentitet eller funktionsvariationer.*

title: Senior Java-utvecklare
description:
🚀
 
 Vi söker en
 
**Senior Javautvecklare**

 till EDGE Associates!
 




 📍
 **Plats:** 
 Stockholm eller Sundsvall
 



  





 🌟
 
 Om rollen
 




 Vill du vara med och utveckla
 **affärskritiska IT-lösningar** 
 för en av Sveriges viktigaste myndigheter? 
 



 Vi på
 **EDGE Associates** 
 söker nu en
 **Senior Javautvecklare** 
 till vårt team - du blir anställd hos oss och börjar direkt i ett
 **uppdrag hos en av våra kunder inom offentlig sektor.** 




  





 🛠️
 
 Kvalifikationer
 




**Vi söker dig som har:** 




 ✔️ Minst
 **5 års erfarenhet av Javautveckling** 




 ✔️ Minst
 **1 års erfarenhet av microservicearkitektur** 




 ✔️ Erfarenhet av
 **Quarkus, Springboot eller liknande** 




 ✔️ Minst
 **3 års erfarenhet** 
 av

 och/eller

 och/eller

 ✔️ Minst
 **3 års erfarenhet** 
 av
 **agilt teamarbete**
