* Erfarenhet av att analysera och följa upp tekniska och affärsmässiga risker kopplade till IT-leveranser.
* Erfarenhet av kravställning och utvärdering vid upphandling.



  





 Rollen innefattar samarbeten med olika delar av Folksam, vilket ställer krav på att du arbetar bra med andra och lyckas skapa engagemang och förståelse för IT-kontinuitet. Vidare kommunicerar du på ett tydligt sätt och säkerställer att budskap går fram.
 



 Du tar självständigt ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och är bra på att få rätt saker gjorda genom att du är handlingskraftig och strukturerad i kombination med en analytisk förmåga och stor leveranskraft.
 



  





**Här kan du göra skillnad** 




 Välkommen till Folksam – här driver du viktiga frågor framåt. Från de avgörande detaljerna till de stora perspektiven, med fokus på att förenkla våra kunders vardag. Det gör att du bidrar till något större, oavsett roll. Här finns det många roliga, utvecklande jobb och du har goda chanser till en spännande karriär.
 



  





 Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Våra moderna kontor bjuder in till samarbete och lärande, här får vi saker att hända! Du har flexibiliteten att kunna varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån, utifrån verksamhetens behov.
 



 Läs mer och se filmer om livet hos oss på folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar.
 



  





**Så söker du jobbet** 




 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag, men senast 7 november 2025.
 



  





 Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta avdelningschef IT-Resilience, Linn Thuvesson, 0708-31 62 95.
 



  





 Fackliga representanter: Forena Morgan Svensson 073-423 59 12, Akademikerföreningen Per Hansson 070-831 60 67 och Handels Mikael A Carlsson 070-831 51 32.
 



  





*Kundägda Folksamgruppen erbjuder sedan 1908 försäkringar och sparande som ger trygghet i livets alla skeden. Vi gör det enklare för våra fyra miljoner kunder att känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld genom rätt försäkringar, rätt sparande och rätt hjälp när något händer.*

title: Validation Engineer/CSV Engineer - Life Sciences
description:
**We are now looking for new colleagues who want to work together with us and develop themselves as a Validation consultant in our Life Sciences team in the greater Stockholm-region!** 








 As a Validation consultant at ALTEN, you'll work with different interesting customers that we support in the pharmaceutical industry. We aim to make a difference for our clients as well as their end users, the patients! Our clients and colleagues are located in Stockholm, Uppsala, Södertälje and Strängnäs.
 



  





 As a consultant, it is important that you are flexible, driven, accurate, efficient, helpful and well-structured while being social and a team player. You must be able to plan, prioritize and perform your tasks independently and in a solution-oriented way.
 



 As an ALTEN consultant, you have a great chance to impact your own development! Once you get some seniority we have great opportunities to develop you into expert roles as well as working in teams and work packages.
 



  





**The role:** 



* Lead, plan, coordinate and/or perform validation and qualification
* Perform qualification and validation test of equipment, process, method, system, and/or instruments
* Issue and review validation plans, protocols and reports
* Investigate deviations and follow up with CAPA
* Define manufacturing processes, equipment, method, system, and/or instruments
* Create or support the creation of URS
* Define, write, review, update validation documentation, perform validation activities, such as validation assessments, validation plans, FAT&SAT protocols, IQOQPQ protocols and reports
* Risk analysis and management
* Initiate and manage change management operations



  





**Essential Requirements** 
 (Education and Experience):
 


* At least Bachelor degree in a relevant science/technical field; e.g. Pharmacy, Biology, Chemistry or Engineering
* At least 2 years of experience with validation and/or qualification within the pharmaceutical industry
* Ability to demonstrate knowledge in GxP
* Ability to work independently under your own initiative
* Good communication and presentation skills
* Problem solving skills
* Fluent in Swedish and English in both written and speech



  





**Valuable Qualification and Experience:** 



* Knowledge in SAP, LIMS
* Knowledge of automation, CSV, 21CFR11 and GAMP5
* Cleaning validation (CV) and/or work in clean rooms
* Sterilization and Aseptic experience
* Good experience of Change Control
* Qualification of process equipment, packaging or analytical instruments IQ/OQ/PQ,
* Excellent knowledge of interpretation of the demands in Eudralex and FDA.



  





**About ALTEN:** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest consulting companies within Engineering, IT and Life Sciences with over 54,000 employees in more than 30 countries. We’re a global actor with a local presence with 1400 committed colleagues in offices from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the product development chain of the most prestigious companies in sectors such as Automotive, Aerospace & Defense, Energy, Manufacturing, Public Sector and Life Sciences.
 



  





 For four years in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.
 







 Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you!
 







***Building tomorrow's future today!***

title: Support Agent
description:
**About Us**
**nShift** 
 is the leading global provider of cloud delivery management solutions (SaaS), we enable the frictionless shipment and return of almost one billion shipments across 190 countries each year. We are headquartered in London and Oslo and have over 500 employees across offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, the United Kingdom, Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Romania.
   

  

 Our software is used by many of the world leading e-commerce, retail, manufacturing, and 3PL shippers due to us having over 1000 carriers integrated into our platform, nearly 3 times more than our competitors!
   

  

 If you buy goods online, there is a strong chance that nShift has powered that delivery, so come and join us as we shape the future of shipping, one frictionless journey at a time.
   

  

**Purpose of Role**
 nShift is on an exciting high-growth journey and we are looking for a Support Agent to join our team in Stockholm, ensuring our customers have a great customer experience.
   

  

 With nShift products being critical within our customers’ end-to-end solutions, it is imperative that they function correctly and that any issues that could affect production are resolved quickly and effectively, in a clear and professional manner.
   

  

 You will work widely with many different types of cases, make demands internally or support our partners with complex troubleshooting - simply a varied everyday life together with your colleagues.
   

  

**The area of responsibility includes:**
* Technical support, provide technical assistance to customers and partners by phone or email
* Provide basic training to customers and colleagues
* Ensure SLA compliance
* Respond and resolve to customer requests in multiple channels
* Be "ahead of the workload" through a proactive attitude
* Participate in building a strong service-oriented team culture where knowledge sharing is central


**Competence And Experience**
**Required professional qualifications:**
* Customer service related work experience
* Fluency in Swedish and English is mandatory


 Advantages to have:
   

  

* Experience working in logistics
* Interest in IT
* Knowledge of other languages
* SaaS company experience


**Required Personality Traits And Skill Set**
* Extensive communication and interpersonal skills
* Positive and team-oriented attitude
* Structured, organized and independent
* An ambitious and commercially driven person that has a key interest in customer service.
* Experience and interest in understanding customers, partners and software product features
* Strong tolerance for and ability to focus and execute in a changing environment
* Good ability to work under pressure with high energy and resilience


**Please ensure you upload your CV in English**
 At nShift we believe in embracing diversity in all forms and fostering an inclusive environment for everyone which we believe is essential for our continued success. We're an equal-opportunity employer which means that all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity, or disability status.

title: Interim/konsult IT-tekniker, Stockholm
description:
**Interim/konsult - IT-tekniker hos kund i Stockholm. Arbeta brett med Microsoft 365, Intune och molntjänster i tekniskt team.**
 Är du en erfaren IT-tekniker som trivs med variation och teknisk bredd? Som konsult hos vår kund i Stockholm får du arbeta i en modern och utvecklande IT-miljö med stort fokus på Microsoftplattformar, molntjänster och Intune. Uppdraget passar dig som gillar att lösa problem, samarbeta i team och samtidigt driva din egen utveckling framåt. Du blir en del av en kunnig organisation där du får påverka både din vardag och de lösningar du jobbar med.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Som Konsult Hos Oss Får Du En Vardag Fylld Av Lärande, Variation Och Tekniska Utmaningar Vi Erbjuder Också
   

  

* Konsultuppdrag i en bred teknisk roll hos etablerad kund
* Arbete med modern teknik inom Microsoft, moln och säkerhet
* Tydliga processer, stark lagkänsla och hjälpsamma kollegor
* Utrymme att påverka arbetssätt och tekniska lösningar


**Det här gör du hos oss**
* Löser ärenden och dokumenterar i ServiceNow
* Arbetar med Microsoft 365, Intune, MSQL och nätverk
* Bidrar till teknisk drift och vidareutveckling av kundmiljöer
* Deltar i både projekt och operativt dagligt arbete
* Utforskar molntjänster som Azure, AWS och Azure Arc


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Uppdraget är placerat hos kund i Stockholm alternativt i Uppsala. Du blir en del av ett större IT-team på omkring 20 personer, organiserat i mindre kundteam med olika fokusområden. Kulturen är samarbetsinriktad med högt engagemang, teknisk nyfikenhet och stark vilja att dela kunskap. Här uppmuntras du att växa i rollen och ta ansvar för både teknik och kundrelationer.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har minst fem års erfarenhet som IT-tekniker eller liknande roll. Du har bred teknisk kompetens inom Microsoftmiljöer, särskilt Microsoft 365, Intune, nätverk, MSQL och molnlösningar. Du är nyfiken, engagerad och gillar att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har god kommunikativ förmåga, ett strukturerat arbetssätt och ett tydligt fokus på att leverera kvalitet till kunden.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du antingen blir anställd av oss på Ada Digital eller anlitas som underkonsult, beroende på vilken lösning som passar dig bäst. I tillsättningen strävar vi efter att ge dig en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Och vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! För att ansöka behöver du inte bifoga några dokument. Skriv istället en kort motivering och bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Urval kommer sker löpande och uppdraget kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Information Technology Specialist
description:
**IT-generalist med extra kärlek för nätverk** 




*Vi söker en IT-generalist med fokus på nätverk som vill vara med och utveckla våra kunders IT-miljöer. Hos QD får du arbeta brett inom IT-drift och infrastruktur samtidigt som du får använda din nätverkskompetens i allt från felsökning till design och förbättringar. Du gillar att ha överblick men är inte rädd för att gå ner på detaljnivå när det behövs. Du ser mönster i trafiken, hittar orsakerna bakom problemen och gillar att bygga lösningar som fungerar över tid.* 




***Din* 
 roll hos oss** 




*Som en del av vårt kundteam får du en central roll i att utveckla och drifta kunders IT-miljöer. Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt. Ibland handlar det om att lösa konkreta nätverksutmaningar, ibland om att planera förbättringar och framtida förändringar.* 




*Du kommer även att delta i större projekt, som migreringar och uppgraderingar av nätverksinfrastruktur. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med kollegor inom drift, system och säkerhet, och med kunder som värdesätter långsiktighet och kvalitet.* 




  





***Krav:***




 -Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet inom följande områden:
 



*- Routing* 
 och switching i vanliga nätverksmiljöer
 



*- Brandväggar och VPN, till exempel Juniper, Cisco eller Fortinet* 




*- Felsökning och övervakning av nätverk* 




*- Grundläggande nätverkssäkerhet och segmentering* 




  





***Meriterande:***




*- Nätverksdesign och dokumentation* 




*- Windows Server, till exempel AD, PKI och RDS* 




*- Linuxmiljöer och backuplösningar* 




*- Molntjänster som* 
 Azure, Entra, Microsoft 365 eller AWS
 



*Vi söker dig som trivs i kundnära roller, gillar att ta ansvar och som vill arbeta i ett team där kvalitet och samarbete går före snabbfixar.* 




  





***Därför trivs man på QD***




***-***
*Flexibilitet: Jobba halva veckan var du vill, hemma, på kontoret eller någon annanstans.* 




*- Kollegorna: Här jobbar du med människor som kan sin sak och delar gärna med sig.* 




*- Rätt storlek: Stora nog för att ge utveckling, små nog för att du ska göra skillnad.* 




*- Teknikpeng: Du väljer utrustningen, vi står för notan.* 




*- Utveckling: Vi gillar när du växer, testar nytt och utmanar oss.* 




  





***Kort om QD***




*QD är ett familjeägt* 
 IT-bolag som grundades 1987. Vi levererar kompletta IT- och driftslösningar till företag i hela Sverige, från våra egna datacenter. Vi är snabba, trygga och värnar om både våra kunder och våra medarbetare. Här kombineras tekniskt djup med omtanke och en arbetsmiljö där det är lätt att trivas.
 



*📍* 
 Placering: Uppsala eller Stockholm
 



***Bakgrundskontroll***




*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomför vi bakgrundskontroller på de kandidater som är aktuella för anställning. Kontrollen görs först efter ditt samtycke.*

title: IT- och Cybersäkerhetsspecialist
description:
*Vi på Martin & Servera levererar mat och dryck till restauranger, kaféer och storkök över hela Sverige. Här är du med och driver utvecklingen i en tid då digitalisering och ny teknik öppnar upp nya dörrar för oss, våra kunder och hela restaurangbranschen. Genom teknik i framkant, nya arbetssätt och en hög förändringstakt är du med och gör varje dag lite godare. Du blir också en del av en varm och inkluderande kultur där vi jobbar tillsammans och har roligt ihop.*
**Om rollen**
 Martin & Servera Gruppen stärker sin förmåga inom informations- och cybersäkerhet. Vi söker nu en IT- och cybersäkerhetsspecialist som vill vara med och vidareutveckla vårt säkerhetsarbete — både tekniskt och processmässigt.
   

  

 Rollen är en central del i CISO-funktionen och bidrar till att utveckla koncernens motståndskraft, säkerställa efterlevnad av NIS2 och ISO 27001, samt stödja affärsområden och IT-organisationen i att arbeta säkert och effektivt. Arbetet utgår från etablerade ramverk som MITRE ATT&CK, ISO/IEC 27001 och NIST CSF för att skapa en strukturerad och riskbaserad säkerhetsstyrning. Rollen är också en nyckel i vårt arbete med att skydda Martin & Serveras information, system och tjänster – från centrala plattformar till våra dotterbolag.
   

  

 Som IT- och cybersäkerhetsspecialist rapporterar du direkt till CISO och samarbetar nära drift, infrastruktur, applikationsförvaltning, externa leverantörer och interna säkerhetsforum.
   

  

**Ditt uppdrag**
**Operativt Ansvar**
 Du kommer att vara drivande i att utveckla, följa upp och stödja den operativa cybersäkerheten i hela Martin & Servera Gruppen. Det innebär:
   

  

* Driva och delta i initiativ för att höja koncernens IT- och cybersäkerhet
* Ansvara för koordinering och uppföljning av koncernens vulnerability management-process tillsammans med IT och leverantörer
* Säkerställa att våra säkerhetslösningar, processer och verktyg stödjer vår riskaptit, strategi och detekteringsförmåga, med särskilt fokus på att använda ramverk som MITRE ATT&CK för att stärka hotanalys och detektion
* Säkerställa att vår SOC-partner levererar enligt krav och förväntan — inklusive uppföljning, kravställning och förbättringsarbete i samverkan med drift och servicedesk
* Delta i och förbättra processer för incidenthantering, sårbarhetshantering och övervakning
* Vara beställare av externa tester och kontroller, såsom penetrationstester och sårbarhetsgranskningar


**Strategiskt Och Rådgivande**
* Stötta projekt och utvecklingsinitiativ ur ett säkerhetsperspektiv, t.ex. vid upphandlingar, arkitekturdiskussioner och tekniska förändringar
* Genomföra och stödja riskanalyser, audit, due diligence och leverantörsgranskningar
* Fungera som bryggan mellan teknik och verksamhet genom att översätta säkerhetsfrågor till tydliga rekommendationer och skapa förståelse i organisationen
* Bidra till kompetenshöjning och säkerhetskultur genom utbildningar, kommunikation och rådgivning


**Din profil**
 Du har en stark teknisk förståelse och erfarenhet av att driva förbättringsarbete inom IT- och cybersäkerhet. Du kombinerar praktisk erfarenhet med ett strategiskt helhetsperspektiv, och trivs i en miljö där du får ta ansvar, samarbeta brett och bidra till långsiktig utveckling.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

* 5–8 års erfarenhet inom IT varav 3 år inom cybersäkerhet
* God förståelse för SOC, SIEM, vulnerability management och incidenthantering
* Erfarenhet av riskanalys, sårbarhetshantering och kravställning
* Kunskap om moln, nätverk, autentisering, servrar och driftmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av både private och public cloud-miljöer
* Vana vid att arbeta i komplexa och delvis outsourcade IT-miljöer
* Mycket god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Meriterande
   

  

* Certifieringar såsom CISSP, CompTIA Security+, eller ISO/IEC 27001 Lead Implementer/Auditor
* Praktisk erfarenhet av arbete enligt ISO/IEC 27001, NIST CSF, MITRE ATT&CK eller CIS Controls
* Erfarenhet av BCP/DRP och krisövningar (tabletop)
* Kännedom om regelverk som GDPR och kommande NIS2 (ISO27001) samt CER
* Erfarenhet av moderna säkerhetsplattformar (XDR, SOAR, SIEM, SASE, DLP)


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Proaktiv och självgående med stark problemlösningsförmåga
* Strukturerad och analytisk med förmåga att skapa ordning och prioritet
* Kommunikativ och pedagogisk – kan förklara komplexa frågor på ett tydligt sätt
* Samarbetsinriktad, prestigelös och trygg i dialoger med både teknik och verksamhet
* Positivt förhållningssätt och lösningsorienterad


**Anställningsform** 
 : Tillsvidareanställning, vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Bolag** 
 : Martin & Servera AB, Lindhagensgatan 133
   

  

**Kontakt** 
 : Vid frågor är du välkomen att kontakta rekryterande chef Anders Björklund, anders.bjorklund@martinservera.se
   

  

**Facklig företrädare:** 
 Anna-Lena Holsteryd, anna-lena.holsteryd@martinservera.se
   

  

**Hur går rekryteringen till?**
 Vi jobbar aktivt för mångfald och ser olikheter mellan människor som en styrka. Med målet att spegla alla våra kunder och samhället vi verkar i, söker vi människor i alla åldrar och med olika bakgrunder. I våra rekryteringar använder vi oss av personlighetstest. Det är för att kunna jämföra kandidater på ett så rättvist sätt som möjligt. Vi gör också bakgrundskontroller. Läs mer om rekryteringen här.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt med en trygg och säker arbetsmiljö, därför utför vi slumpmässiga drog- och alkoholtester på våra arbetsplatser.
   

  

**Välkommen till Martin & Servera**
 Tillsammans gör vi på Martin & Servera-gruppen skillnad för alla som älskar mat och dryck. Med omtanke om varandra, våra kunder och allas framtid gör vi varje dag lite godare. Och som medarbetare hos oss är du en viktig del av framgången. På Martin & Servera växer vi och utvecklas tillsammans samtidigt som alla är viktiga och får ta plats. Vi är en familjeägd koncern med över 3000 medarbetare. Här tas dina erfarenheter, idéer och kunskaper tillvara. Välkommen till oss.

title: Team Lead Support till företag inom e-hälsa
description:
Är du en resultatinriktad och inspirerande ledare med teknisk kompetens och en passion för kundservice? Vill du leda och utveckla ett supportteam i en dynamisk och samhällsviktig miljö? Då kan denna roll som
 **Team Lead Support** 
 hos oss på CGM vara något för dig!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Team Lead Support har du det övergripande ansvaret för supportteamet inom CGM Sverige. Du säkerställer en effektiv supportverksamhet med fokus på hög kundnöjdhet, kvalitet och ständig förbättring. Du leder teamets dagliga arbete, utvecklar processer och arbetar nära både kunder och interna team.
 



  





 Vårt supportteam är en viktig del av vår leverans – vi stöttar kunder inom hela e-hälsosektorn: regioner, företagshälsovård, kriminalvård, elevhälsa, kommunal omsorg och laboratorieverksamhet. Vi erbjuder support för våra journalsystem (
 *TakeCare, CGM J4, PMO och CGM@home* 
 ) samt vårt laboratorieinformationssystem (
 *ANALYTIX* 
 ).
 



  





 Supportens ansvarsområden inkluderar:
 


* **Handhavande och teknisk support** 
 : Vi guidar användare genom våra produkter och system, oavsett om det handlar om journalsystem, implementering eller tekniska frågor.
* **Fjärrsupport** 
 : Våra experter kan snabbt koppla upp sig och lösa problem direkt i kundens miljö.
* **Support via telefon och e-post** 
 : Tillgänglighet och tydlig kommunikation är nyckeln till vårt arbete.



  





 Som Team Lead är du med och utvecklar både teamet och våra arbetssätt för att fortsatt kunna leverera support i toppklass.
 



  





**Dina ansvarsområden:** 



* Säkerställa att supportleveransen håller hög kvalitet och möter våra kundavtal (SLA)
* Optimera kundresan genom förbättringsarbete och uppföljning av nyckeltal inom supportverksamheten
* Kontinuerlig förbättring av processer och arbetssätt i relation till AI-strategier och korsfunktionella samarbeten i linje med CGM:s ledningssystem
* Coacha och stötta teamets medarbetare i deras dagliga arbete
* Ha en aktiv dialog med interna intressenter och föra vidare kundfeedback



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 



* Flera års erfarenhet av teknisk support, gärna inom komplexa IT-/e-hälsosystem
* Erfarenhet av personalansvar och att coacha team
* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning, gärna inom IT eller systemvetenskap
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* God teknisk förståelse och vana att arbeta med process- och kvalitetsuppföljning



  





**Personliga egenskaper:** 



* Du är resultatorienterad och har ett tydligt ledarskap
* Du är kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och pedagogisk
* Du motiveras av att förbättra kundupplevelsen och skapa struktur i en föränderlig vardag
* Du trivs med att kombinera teknik, människor och kundnytta



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Hos oss får du möjlighet att jobba tillsammans med ett engagerat team där alla arbetar mot samma mål – att bidra till en bättre och mer effektiv vård. Vi erbjuder dig:
 



  




* Komplexa och utmanande arbetsuppgifter
* Möjligheten att påverka framtidens sjukvård
* En arbetsplats i ljusa och moderna lokaler i Solna
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag och en friskvårdstimme i veckan
* Möjlighet till distansarbete en dag i veckan
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, heltid, med inledande provanställning 6 månader
* Kollektivavtal



  





**Ansökan** 




 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse. Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Karin Bogren på karin.bogren@partner.cgm.com.
 



  





**Vår rekryteringsprocess** 




 Första steget är ett kortare videosamtal med vår rekryterare där vi berättar mer om tjänsten och lär känna dig bättre. Därefter följer intervjuer med din framtida chef och kollegor.
 



  





 Om du går vidare till slutskedet av processen kommer vi att be om referenser samt genomföra en bakgrundskontroll innan vi erbjuder dig en anställning.
 



 Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!
 



  





  





*CGMs vision ”Synchronizing healthcare” genomsyrar allt vårt arbete. Vi är marknadsledande leverantör av IT-lösningar och kommunikationstjänster inom hälso- och sjukvård, social omsorg, företagshälsovård, barn – och elevhälsovård samt kliniska laboratorium i Sverige. Vår drivkraft är att göra nytta för patienten via våra e-hälsolösningar. Behovet av nya lösningar är under ständig utveckling, vilket ställer höga krav på oss som leverantör. Tillsammans med våra kunder är vi starkt engagerade i att förverkliga Sveriges e-hälsovision om att bli bäst i världen på att använda digitaliseringens och e-hälsans möjligheter.*

title: Product Specialist - D365FO
description:
Role Description:
 



 Minimum of 5 years of working within digital product development, with a strong business acumen and strategic mindset.
 



 · Self-leadership and a “can-do mentality”.
 



 · Strong expertise and solid understanding of the functionality within Dynamics D365FO and Azure.
 



 · Extensive experience of Power Platform in the context of Dynamics D365FO e.g. Power Apps and Power Automate.
 



 · Good knowledge of JIRA and Azure Devops.
 



 · Experience in ITIL, agile frameworks, service governance models, and DevOps concepts.
 



 · Strong understanding of prioritization during business-critical issues.
 



 · Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
 



 · Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
 



  





 Competencies: Digital : Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance
 



  





  





 Essential Skills:
 



 • Monitor and identify opportunities for digital product enhancements, aligning with product priorities and collaborating with the Product Owner and agile team.
 



 • Measure and analyze product performance against business goals and KPIs; use insights to support roadmap decisions.
 



 • Gather, analyze, challenge, and document detailed product requirements including use cases, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
 



 • Lead solution identification to maximize value, reduce risks, and manage stakeholder expectations, ensuring reuse of common technical capabilities.
 



 • Facilitate cross-functional collaboration, remove delivery blockers, and support product planning by clarifying backlog items and success metrics.
 



 • Understand and communicate stakeholder needs to the product team, ensuring development aligns with expectations.
 



 • Act as a subject matter expert, offering recommendations based on industry and technology trends; assist in creating business blueprints.
 



 • Develop and deliver training materials as part of the product’s learning offer.
 



 • Contribute to achieving performance objectives and indicators.
 



 • Promote consistency in workflows and tools, and actively support the evolution of the digital organization.

title: Technical Field Engineer
description:
Ready to Power Progress in the Nordics? Become Our Next Nordic Technical Field Engineer - Industry Lubricants
   

  

**Employment** 
 Full time, permanent
   

  

**Start** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Location** 
 Home based covering primarily Sweden and Finland, with travel across the Nordic countries
   

  

 Are you passionate about helping industrial customers achieve their strategic goals while optimizing production, reducing total cost of ownership, and lowering their carbon footprint?
   

  

 At TotalEnergies, we don't just sell lubricants - we enable transformation. As our Nordic Technical Field Engineer, you'll be at the heart of driving sustainable performance across a diverse and dynamic industrial landscape. You'll work hand-in-hand with our sales teams to deliver high-impact technical solutions that support our ambitious growth plans and contribute directly to our business success.
   

  

 You will report to the
 **Lubricants Industry Sales Manager Nordic** 
 and be part of a
 **committed and engaged Lubricants industry team** 
 .
   

  

 This is your opportunity to join one of the world's leading energy companies and make a real difference - not just in our business, but in the future of industry.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
 Technical support and Customer support
   

  

* Train and advise sales teams and customers on industrial products and technical services
* Provide technical assistance to customers together with Sales. E.g. technical audits, inspections and open gear cleaning at customer sites, actively demonstrating Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) approach.
* Maintain the services associated with the sale (audits, analysis, lubrication software, grease plans, briefing notes, arguments, etc.).
* Participate in sales training and product courses.
* Handle technical complaints in collaboration with HQ.
* Participating in international Technical Meetings
* Ensure application of Health, Safety, Environment & Quality policy of the TotalEnergies Nordic Hub.


 Sales and business development
   

  

* Collaborate with the Sales Managers to achieve the sales objectives
* Participate in sales meetings, courses and other customer events
* Visit customers and prospects and participate in the identification of growth opportunities
* CRM system Responsible for accurate and updated information


**What You Bring To The Table**
 Professionally
   

  

* Bachelor of Chemical Sciences/engineer and/or 3-5 years of experience in a similar position
* Documented technical knowledge of industrial processes, equipment and lubrication applications
* Comprehensive experience in the Industrial lubricants business and the various product segments and ability to master the main aspects of this activity
* Customer management and sales experience
* High level of customer and technical orientation
* Solid Microsoft Office skills
* Fluency in Swedish or one of the Nordic languages and English is mandatory. French is an advantage but not required.


 Personally
   

  

 You're a confident communicator who connects easily with people at all levels - from the factory floor to the boardroom. Proactive and self-driven, you thrive on solving challenges and making things happen. Your structured approach and sharp planning skills help you stay focused on what matters most, even in fast-paced and demanding environments.
   

  

 You're energized by being on the move, motivated by travel, and unfazed by pressure. You know how to prioritize, adapt, and deliver - always with the customer's success in mind.
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

* Home based office
* Travel activity 2-3 days a week
* Geographical preference Mid- Sweden


**What We Bring**
* A flexible job where you have the chance to shape your own daily routine
* Becoming part of an international company with a high diversity
* Continuous training and development - up to 5 days a year
* Competitive compensation package including company car


**Come join one of the world's major players in the global energy transition**
 TotalEnergies is a broad energy company that produces and markets oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables, and electricity. With over 100,000 employees, TotalEnergies is committed to better energy that is more affordable, more reliable, cleaner, and accessible to as many people as possible. We are the largest oil and gas operator in Denmark, but our vision is clear when it comes to supporting the transition towards a low-carbon future.
   

  

**Safety - Respect for Each Other - Pioneer Spirit - Stand Together - Performance Minded**
**Interested?** 
 For this recruitment, we are partnering with Jefferson Wells, a ManpowerGroup company. If you have any questions, please contact the responsible Recruitment Consultant, Sara Bahlenberg, at +46 70 790 86 26 or sara.bahlenberg@jeffersonwells.se. We review applications on a rolling basis, so please submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Contract Manager - IT SW and Services
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Ericsson Cloud Software & Services (BCSS) delivers cloud-native solutions for 5G Core, Automation and AI, Managed Services, and OSS/BSS. Our customers are Communications Service Providers (CSPs), commonly known as telecom operators, who are adopting 5G, cloud, and AI to build resilient networks, create new services, and monetize them. BCSS is a global team of about 30,000 people serving customers in 180+ countries.
   

  

 You will join Tactical & Contract Engagement (T&CE) which is a team within BCSS Sales and Commercial Management. In your role, you will focus on servicing one of the BCSS Solution Areas: Business & Operations Support Systems (SA BOS) and their GTM strategy from a contract management perspective. SA BOS designs and delivers software and IT solutions that help telecom operators run their business and networks more efficiently, including tools for managing customers, billing, and network operations, available as ready-made products or customized services.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 As a Contract Manager you will
   

  

 develop contractual assets & guidance that define best practice for deployment by our local Contract Management teams, develop and deliver engaging training in mixed mode to various stakeholder communities, and support local teams with drafting and negotiation assistance on critical deals. This will involve:
   

  

* Acting as change agent to support evolution in contracting approach for SA BOS, executing a more IT-style of contracting and engagement than Ericsson’s traditional telco base.
* Evolving Contracting Templates in support of SA BOS strategic direction
* Supporting evolution of SA BOS Portfolio from a contracting perspective, articulating the contractual guiderails and clauses needed for new offerings with new technology base & risk profile (e.g., aaS, AI content)
* Developing & evolving guidance (e.g. golden rules, model clause examples etc.) and embed this in practice by providing training & workshops to the BA & MA communities to support continual development and improve contract discipline
* Acting as BCSS Contract Management SME & provide support to wider Sales and Commercial Management & SA BOS Teams and assigned geographies on selected customer engagements, includes supporting customer negotiation
* Harvesting good practice examples aligned to strategy across assigned MA(s)
* Guiding and assisting on interpretation of contractual clauses and obligations as required by the business with reference to Group Legal. Includes recommendations to BCSS Head of Sales & Commercial Management on escalated deviations from Ericsson wanted positions.
* Providing Contract Management expertise into other SCM projects and programs


**The skills you bring:**
 For this role we are looking for a Contract Manager with a proven track record of success in contract management with strong prior experience in IT services projects & engagements.
   

  

 In addition we expect you to have:
   

  

* Awareness of contractual and business law and ability to deliver high quality contract drafting
* Ability to support negotiations, ideally be able to lead contractual negotiation and customer discussion
* Ability to communicate & influence at senior level
* Creative, innovative mind-set to develop well thought-through approaches and overcome contractual challenges
* Confidence to work self-managed in a fast paced and exciting environment
* WorldCC / IACCM certification or equivalent is a plus
* Proficiency in English both written and oral is a must, additional multiple languages are a plus


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 774129

title: Embedded Software Architect – Automotive ECU Development
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are looking for a deeply skilled consultant to support an assignment focused on ECU software development in the automotive domain. You need at least +10 years experience in automotive and software development. Worked both on architecture level and with software development.
   

  

**Key Competencies:**
* Experience working with Automotive software platform.
* Deep understanding of automotive E/E architecture.
* Strong experience in C programming for embedded systems.
* Proven background in ECU SW development within the automotive industry.
* Knowledge of middleware, ARM architecture, and CAN protocols.
* Familiarity with AUTOSAR standards.


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Cloud Solution Architect - Azure Platform (Infrastructure)
description:
With more than 45,000 employees and partners worldwide, the Customer Experience and Success (CE&S) organization is on a mission to empower customers to accelerate business value through differentiated customer experiences that leverage Microsoft’s products and services, ignited by our people and culture. We drive cross-company alignment and execution, ensuring that we consistently exceed customers’ expectations in every interaction, whether in-product, digital, or human-centered. CE&S is responsible for all up services across the company, including consulting, customer success, and support across Microsoft’s portfolio of solutions and products. Join CE&S and help us accelerate AI transformation for our customers and the world.
   

  

 We are looking for a Cloud Solution Architect (CSA), specializing in Azure Platform (infrastructure), who is passionate about driving our customers’ transformation on Microsoft Azure. This is a customer-facing role, helping customers to leverage their Microsoft investments through architecture, and operational health engagements.
   

  

 You’ll work with customer IT teams to design and implement scalable solutions, resolve blockers, and accelerate adoption of Azure services. With broad knowledge and experience across Azure Platform, you’ll play a key role in helping customers unlock the full value of their Microsoft Azure investments.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Deliver migration and modernization initiatives, including Proof of Concept and production milestones, across infrastructure, data, and AI workloads.
* Ensure customer environments are optimized for health, resiliency, security, and performance—enabling production-scale AI use cases.
* Deliver repeatable IP and contribute to centralized IP development to accelerate deployment and achieve targeted outcomes.
* Identify and resolve technical blockers to accelerate go-live and ensure delivery excellence across key Factory engagements.
* Maintain technical intensity through continuous skilling and certifications in priority Azure workloads.
* Engage in technical communities, share best practices, and contribute to knowledge reuse to accelerate customer transformation and success.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND 2+ years experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
+ OR equivalent experience

* Fluent in of both Swedish and English - Spoken and written.
* Currently based in Sweden


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Avdelningschef till Videnca
description:
*Vill du leda, utveckla och forma framtiden för en SaaS-avdelning med fokus på säkerhet och kundnytta?* 
*Videnca söker nu en Avdelningschef för SaaS som tar helhetsansvar för vår SaaS-leverans, våra kunder och vårt team.* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Avdelningschef för SaaS ansvarar du för att driva och utveckla både avdelningen och våra kundrelationer. Våra kunder är främst privata företag som förlitar sig på att Videnca driftar och säkerställer deras SaaS-plattformar – plattformar som i sin tur möjliggör våra kunders affär.
 



  





**Ditt ansvar omfattar:** 



* Ledarskap & personalansvar – coacha, utveckla och inspirera teamet.
* Drift- och säkerhetsansvar – säkerställa stabil, säker och effektiv leverans av våra plattformar.
* Kundutveckling & relationer – utveckla samarbetet med befintliga kunder och identifiera nya möjligheter.
* Projektledning – driva initiativ och projekt från idé till färdig lösning.
* Tekniskt ansvar – med bakgrund inom både Windows- och Linuxmiljöer.



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 Vi letar efter dig som är en kombination av teknisk ledare och strategisk utvecklare. Du är van att arbeta nära både teknik och affär, och trivs i en miljö där säkerhet, tillgänglighet och innovation står i centrum.
 



  





**Vi tror att du har:** 



* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av personalansvar och att bygga starka team.
* Erfarenhet av projektledning och kunddrivna IT-projekt.
* Teknisk bakgrund med goda kunskaper i Windows- och Linuxmiljöer.
* Ett analytiskt förhållningssätt och förmågan att utmana gamla och nya idéer.
* En driven, handlingskraftig och lösningsorienterad personlighet.



  





**Varför Videnca?** 




 Hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i ett företag där kundens affär alltid står i fokus. Vi värdesätter engagemang, nytänkande och samarbete. Som Avdelningschef får du inte bara ansvaret för att leda – du får också möjligheten att påverka hur våra SaaS-lösningar fortsätter utvecklas i en snabbt föränderlig bransch.
 



  





**Viktigt att veta** 




 Tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad, vilket innebär att du genomgår säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen. Du behöver därför vara svensk medborgare.
 



 Rollen kräver B-körkort, då du ibland reser till Videncas olika datahallar.
 



  





 Det här är en heltidstjänst (100%), främst under kontorstid. Periodvis kan arbetet innebära schemalagda pass på kvällar eller helger. Du kommer att jobba ute i våra datahallar och på huvudkontoret.
 



  





**Praktisk information** 



* Anställningen är säkerhetsklassad vilket innebär säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen. Du behöver därför vara svensk medborgare.
* Urvalet och intervjuer sker löpande, vänta därför inte med din ansökan!

title: Handläggare
description:
Dina arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Anställningen är placerad på City åklagarkammare i centrala Stockholm. Som handläggare möter du en händelserik vardag med varierande arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

 Du arbetar självständigt men också tillsammans i grupp för att få det administrativa arbetet att fungera. Service är en stor del i ditt vardagliga arbete, både internt och externt.
   

  

**I Arbetsuppgifterna Ingår Bl.a. Att**
* ge åklagare administrativt stöd, t.ex. arbete i brottsmålsdiariet, hantera arkivering och utföra allmänna kontorsuppgifter
* kontrollera, bedöma och registrera inkomna ärenden
* vara kontakten utåt i många sammanhang och därmed ge god service till både allmänheten och till andra myndigheter – främst via telefon och e-post
* utföra arbetsuppgifter som fördelas från administrativ chef t.ex. viss beredning.


 Vardagen är händelsestyrd och det kan snabbt inkomma brådskande ärenden som gör att du behöver ta snabba beslut och kunna göra en avvägning av vad som är brådskande eller inte.
   

  

 Dina kvaliteter och kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har gymnasieexamen eller annan utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig
* har aktuell och relevant skicklighet som motsvarar några års väl vitsordat arbete med administrativa uppgifter
* har aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av arbete i it-miljö och med digitala verktyg inom administration, telefoni, möten m.m.
* har goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift.


 Som person vill vi att du
   

  

* är noggrann, strukturerad och kan följa de förhållningsregler och rutiner som finns
* är självständig och ansvarstagande
* är stresstålig då arbetsbelastningen vid vissa tillfällen kan vara hög
* är stabil med god självkännedom
* har lätt för att samarbeta och har ett öppet förhållningssätt gentemot din omgivning
* är serviceinriktad
* har god kommunikationsförmåga.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Det är meriterande med erfarenhet av arbete inom rättsväsendet.
   

  

 Om anställningen
   

  

 Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Inför erbjudande om anställning kan det bli aktuellt för Åklagarmyndigheten att genomföra registerkontroll i misstankeregistret och belastningsregistret. Registerkontrollen genomförs på slutkandidaten. Det kan även bli aktuellt att bli inplacerad i säkerhetsklass vilket innebär att en säkerhetsprövning med tillhörande registerkontroll genomförs på slutkandidaten.
   

  

 Tester kan förekomma i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Åklagarmyndigheten är en beredskapsmyndighet. Vid en anställning kan du komma att krigsplaceras på Åklagarmyndigheten. Läs mer under Jobba hos oss.
   

  

 På grund av arkivbestämmelser sparar vi ansökningar i två år. När du ansöker kommer dina personuppgifter att behandlas enligt offentlighetsprincipen samt dataskyddsförordningen. När du skickar din ansökan till oss, samtycker du till detta.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du skickar in din ansökan på svenska.
   

  

 Åklagarmyndigheten som arbetsgivare
   

  

 På Åklagarmyndigheten känner vi stolthet när vi går till jobbet. Tillsammans är vi över 2 200 engagerade och kompetenta medarbetare som står upp för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och demokratiska värden. Oavsett roll i myndigheten så bidrar alla till vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag.
   

  

 Vill du bli en del av Åklagarmyndigheten? Vi strävar efter att vara en välkomnande och inkluderande arbetsplats som speglar samhällets mångfald.
   

  

 Ansök redan i dag!

title: QA/QC-Lead – Mechanical
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 The QA/QC Lead-Mechanical is responsible for developing and owning the quality plan specific to the mechanical engineering aspects of the project. The role ensures that the right tools, methods and equipment are used for quality work in the mechanical area and reports to the overall QA/QC Lead. You will supervise the activities of dedicated QA/QC coordinators (for example for rotating equipment and piping systems)
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Own and assist in the development of the quality plan for the mechanical parts of the project, and ensure that it meets project specifications, standards and regulations.
* Ensure that the right tools, procedures and equipment are used for quality assurance in the mechanical area.
* Oversee all QA/QC activities in the mechanical area, including inspections, audits and tests, to ensure that quality standards are met.
* Coordinate and support the QA/QC team in the mechanical area to ensure effective quality control.
* Collaborate with work area managers, construction management and technical teams to quickly resolve mechanical quality issues and provide guidance.
* Ensure that all mechanical Construction and manufacturing activities comply with projects, specifications, industry standards and regulations.
* Work closely with contractors to ensure quality assurance and quality controls are met including reviewing the contractor's quality plan and providing feedback.
* Evaluate the contractor's quality system as per contract.
* Review inspection reports from contractors to the rest of the team.
* Coordinate with the contractor's engineering team to make necessary adjustments to design decisions and prepare change orders as needed.
* Organize regular meetings to follow up on results of quality audits.
* Coordinate with third party inspectors and other relevant agencies as needed.
* Provide regular updates to the QA/QC Lead on mechanical QA/QC performance, issues and solutions.
* The role is also expected to participate in key cross-functional meetings to coordinate interfaces, as well as ad-hoc and internal working meetings and monthly meeting.


**Advantage if you have experience in:**
* Projects in the process or energy industry
* Industry-specific standards and requirements
* Good knowledge of current welding standards


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Senior Machine Learning Architect | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Shape the future of AI-driven financial solutions!
   

  

 We’re seeking a Senior Machine Learning Architect to design and implement scalable, responsible AI solutions within a highly regulated environment.
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and multiple technology paths. Together, we’re innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.
   

  

 Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, this opportunity is for you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Machine Learning Architect in our platform team, your mission is to enable and empower other teams to build and deploy AI/ML solutions responsibly and at scale. You will design and evolve the ML platform capabilities, ensuring they are robust, compliant, and aligned with regulatory frameworks such as the AI Act (EU AI Regulation). This role is about enabling scale, compliance, and innovation—not building models, but building the foundation that makes responsible AI possible.
   

  

**You’ll work closely with other architects, ML engineering, data science, and compliance teams to:**
* Develop and maintain ML platform components (e.g., infrastructure for data ingestion and preparation, model training and experimentation, model deployment and serving as well as monitoring solutions) that support scalable and secure ML workflows.
* Define and implement compliance and governance frameworks for ML model lifecycle management.
* Provide Machine Learning (ML) golden paths, blueprints and modules to enable teams to deploy ML workloads (primary GCP but we act in multi-cloud).
* Support GPU-accelerated training, distributed computing, and observability tooling to ensure performance and transparency.
* Promote Responsible AI practices by embedding explainability, interpretability, and ethical design into platform capabilities.
* Enable CI/CD pipelines, microservices, and API-first architectures for ML services across the organization.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience designing and enabling scalable ML platforms and infrastructure on cloud environments such as GCP, Azure, or AWS.
* A strong understanding of ML model governance, with hands-on experience implementing Responsible AI practices in line with data privacy, security, and the AI Act (EU AI Regulation).
* Solid knowledge of MLOps principles, with a deep understanding of the full machine learning lifecycle and the resources and tooling needed at each stage. Proven ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to implement and optimize key MLOps components such as feature stores, model registries, and data pipelines.
* Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform.
* Experience supporting distributed training on GPU-accelerated workloads and enabling observability and monitoring for ML systems.


**What We Offer**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Mobility within a large global company
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025-10-30. If you have questions about the position, please contact Lars Lindgren, lars.lindgren@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes, for example, identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Property Systems Support (Parental Leave Replacement)
description:
**Ready to swap check-ins for system setups? This one’s for you!**
 If you’ve built your career in front office operations and want to learn more about the systems that keep everything running, this is your chance to take that next step.
   

  

 We are looking for a tech-savvy hospitality professional to join the BWH Hotels Scandinavia team for an 8-month period, starting from February 1st 2026.
   

  

 You will be joining our Property Systems Team - a dynamic and supportive bunch who help our hotels across Scandinavia make the most out of their systems and connections.
   

  

 If you’re curious about how PMS, CRS, and distribution channels work together (and those words don’t sound foreign to you!), we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Take ownership of PMS setup audits to ensure hotels are correctly configured and connected to our CRS
* Support technical onboarding of new hotels joining our portfolio
* Assist hotels with PMS connectivity, setup and CRS management questions
* Contribute to ongoing projects aimed at improving system efficiency & integrations
* Collaborate closely with internal teams and vendors to ensure smooth daily operations and reliable system performance


**Your superpowers**
* You have 2-3 years’ experience in hotel reservations or front office
* You have in-depth knowledge of at least one PMS system: Opera | Opera Cloud | Hotsoft | Mews | Protel Cloud
* You’re a team player with a can-do attitude and a service-oriented mindset
* You’re curious, detail-focused, and love helping others solve challenge
* You are able to communicate fluently in Swedish and English


**Why you’ll love it here**
 This role is a perfect bridge between hotel operations and hospitality tech.
   

  

 You will gain hands-on experience with system integrations, digital guest journeys and property onboardings while being part of a collaborative, fun and forward-thinking team.
   

  

 If you would like to enhance your current Front Office or Reservations knowledge to really understand what makes systems connect - this job will be a perfect opportunity for you.
   

  

**BWH Hotels Scandinavia – local gems everywhere in Scandinavia**
 We are Scandinavia’s largest collective group of family- and privately-owned hotels. We are a large and quite diverse family, with many different personalities and offerings, but at our core we all share the same belief. The belief in genuine hospitality.
   

  

 Through knowledge and commitment, we ensure an experience of high quality. We are professional, with a colourful and personal tone. We believe in teamwork, why we find it important that we work together to challenge the hotel industry. You will be a part of a unique hotel chain, where we offer more personalized experiences for all our guests in Scandinavia.
   

  

 BWH Hotels is a leading, global hotel chain consisting of three hotel groups, Best Western Hotels & Resorts, WorldHotels and Sure Hotel Group. There are approximately 4,300 hotels worldwide and in Scandinavia there are over 170 hotels spread across more than 100 destinations.

title: Senior Tech Partner & Implementation Manager
description:
The
 **Senior Tech Partner & Implementation Manager** 
 plays a pivotal role in driving technological innovations and solutions for digital marketing across TUI.
 



 As a key bridge between digital marketing operations and technology teams, this role ensures successful implementation of digital strategies, optimising efficiency and enhancing customer experiences.
 



 This position is critical to TUI’s digital transformation journey, supporting scalable performance marketing solutions in a high-growth, global context. The role also owns the commercial and contractual relationships with TUI’s key marketing technology partners such as Google, Meta, Smartly and others – ensuring contracts, SLAs and renewals are managed effectively and in alignment with Procurement, Legal and Data Protection teams. It leads the preparation and coordination of Joint Business Plans (JBPs) and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) across all markets, driving accountability, partnership value, and compliance in execution.
 



***Become part of our team - applications open! This role will be advertised for a minimum of 14 days but could close anytime after this time so don't delay!***




**About Our Offer** 



* Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, bonus opportunity, exclusive travel perks & discounts, extensive health & wellbeing support, and more.
* Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer hybrid or remote working models.
* A career to shape: Opportunities to upskill, reskill and grow your career. Access the TUI Tech Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
* Expand your horizons: Participate in our tech communities and collaborate on global projects and teams.
* Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation and the Sustainable Tech Community.



**About The Job** 



* Collaborate with relevant stakeholders in IT and across the regions to define ultimate technology roadmap for digital marketing solutions aligned with business objectives.
* Implement end to end delivery of technology solutions, ensuring seamless integration into E2E aligned operational processes with all the regions and adjoining departments.
* Partner with teams in operations, marketing, finance, and customer service to identify tech-driven efficiencies, Solutions need to be connected with other (internal & external) systems and be fed with all the necessary data
* Lead cross-functional implementation projects from planning to post-launch optimization with full implementation in all regions
* Own and manage contractual relationships and partner operations with key global vendors (Google, Meta, Smartly, etc.), coordinating with Procurement, Legal, and Data Protection to ensure all solutions and agreements meet TUI’s compliance, privacy, and governance standards
* Lead and coordinate Joint Business Plans (JBPs), Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs), and related partner reporting and administrative processes to ensure consistency and strategic alignment across all markets.
* Maintain relationships with third-party technology providers, like Google, Meta, negotiating service agreements to maximize performance
* Utilise analytics and key performance metrics to refine digital strategies. Set standards for reporting and monitor performance to define actions for improvement
* Drive user adoption and engagement by implementing effective training programs for all stakeholders in regions and stakeholder communication strategies
* Ensure technological implementations align with regulatory and security standards.



**About You** 



* Demonstratable experience in technology implementation and digital transformation roles
* Proven experience in leading large-scale projects within corporate environments, ideally within the travel industry
* Strong experience managing external technology vendors and owning global contracts, renewals, and SLAs
* Experience with cloud-based systems and digital tools
* Strong knowledge of industry trends and emerging technologies
* Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills, able to develop trusted working relationships across business boundaries
* Exceptional commercial acumen with a target-driven approach and passion for implementing data-driven ideas to maximize growth
* Solid understanding of data privacy, governance, and compliance frameworks (GDPR, platform consent models) and ability to align external partners to these requirements
* Exceptional communication skills, able to translate data into easy-to-understand insights and clearly communicate performance to stakeholders at all levels
* Ability to build presentations that condense data into easy-to-understand insights and recommendations



 From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.
 



 We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

title: Product Evangelist
description:
**TL;DR -** 
 We’re looking for a magnetic, world-class product evangelist to represent Lovable at hackathons, customer HQs, and community events and to build educational content. You’ll inspire people to build, make them successful, and share their stories with the world. If you love teaching, building, and energizing communities, you’ll thrive here.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Track record of public speaking, community engagement, or developer advocacy.
* Deep passion for building software and teaching others.
* Strong presentation skills: equally at ease in enterprise boardrooms and grassroots community events.
* Ability to produce educational content across text, video, and web formats.
* Comfortable on camera. Can record video tutorials and engaging live sessions.
* Obsessed with seeing others succeed and turning their dreams into reality.
* Passionate about AI and emerging technologies.
* Previous experience as a developer advocate, evangelist, or community builder
* You have already built and shipped using Lovable!


**What You’ll Do**
* Create and represent Lovable at hackathons, community events, and enterprise customer events - equipping people to build successfully.
* Be Lovable. Bring a magnetic presence that energizes people and inspires them to create with Lovable.
* Present polished, compelling talks and workshops for audiences big and small. Technical and non-technical.
* Be the vibe coding expert. Go deep on Lovable’s tools and show others how to unlock their potential.
* Produce text, video, and interactive content that educates and activates users.
* Host video sessions, livestreams, and lessons that spread Lovable know-how.
* Work together with the marketing team to champion community success; Celebrate user wins, share their stories, and help people pursue their dreams.


**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* We'll send you a quick take-home asking to present your best work over a loom video presentation.
* Join us for a round of interviews to discuss your experience in more depth
* Join us for trial work lasting 1-2 days remote or on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

title: Website Strategy Director
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Embark on an enriching career path with Ericsson as an
 **Website Strategy Director** 
 . The Website and Intranet team (mostly Stockholm) aims to become more commercially driven, delivering on digital (dotcom) ambitions to support company strategy and new audiences. effectiveness for our partner ecosystem.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 Responsibilities include digital strategy (dotcom & extranet), UX, content, SEO, and platform ownership. This hire is key to establishing a unified, commercially-driven digital strategy, elevating B2B UX, driving data-driven optimization, and strengthening extranet.
   

  

**The skills you bring:**
* Ability to develop and articulate a cohesive long-term strategic vision for both the public website and the extranet, aligning with overall business goals.
* Proficiency in conducting market analysis, competitive research, and trend forecasting (including B2B portal trends) to inform strategic decisions.
* Skill in creating and managing a unified roadmap, outlining strategic initiatives and priorities for the website platform.
* Deep understanding of UX principles and best practices for B2B user experiences.
* Ability to champion a user-centric approach across the organization, considering diverse user needs (customers, partners, etc.).
* Expertise in user research methodologies, including those specific to B2B user behaviour, and the ability to translate user insights into actionable strategies for our website platform.
* Strong understanding of business principles, financial metrics, and ROI analysis for both website and extranet initiatives.
* Ability to align website and extranet strategies with business objectives, demonstrating the value of both platforms in achieving organizational goals.
* Proficiency in analysing platform data and performance metrics to identify opportunities for improvement and optimization.
* Understanding of digital marketing strategies and their integration with website initiatives.
* Ability to ensure website content and design align with brand guidelines and messaging.
* Knowledge of SEO, content marketing, and other digital marketing best practices.
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to diverse audiences (internal teams, external partners).
* Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders across the organization and influence decision-making for both platforms.
* Skill in facilitating collaborative discussions and resolving conflicts, particularly in the context of B2B partnerships.
* Expertise in using website and extranet analytics tools and interpreting data to inform strategic decisions.
* Ability to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and track platform performance against goals.
* Proficiency in using data visualization techniques to communicate insights effectively.
* A proactive approach to identifying and evaluating emerging digital trends and technologies relevant to both public websites and B2B portals.
* Ability to foster a culture of innovation and experimentation within the website and extranet teams.
* Understanding of web accessibility standards and security best practices.
* Deep understanding of B2B relationship management and the role of extranets in supporting partner ecosystems.
* Expertise in extranet security best practices, data privacy regulations, and access control management.
* Knowledge of extranet platform technologies, integration with CRM/ERP systems, and data exchange protocols.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 768845

title: Mechanical Design Engineer - Wave Energy
description:
Working at CorPower Ocean you will be part of a world class team, committed to make big impact. We are on a mission to bring reliable and competitive wave energy to the world. We offer a high degree of freedom and flexibility, combined with great personal responsibility. CorPower Ocean is a global leader in wave energy, with a technology that has shown game-changing performance. Your work will contribute to the global transition to renewable energy by unlocking one of the largest untapped sources of clean energy on earth.
 



**Role** 




 We are seeking a mechanical design engineer with a focus on electrical hardware integration, to develop and optimise our innovative wave energy converters. You will be part of the mechanical group and will collaborate across electrical, software, control, supply chain as well as integration and testing teams.
 



**Responsibil** 
**ities** 



* Module owner of Wave Energy Converter subsystems
* Bridge the mechanical and electrical – integrating electrical hardware in a safe, accessible and space-efficient manner
* Produce 3D models & 2D drawings of frames, supports, access equipment
* Perform engineering calculations & simulations (static structural, fatigue)
* Produce technical documentation
* Perform failure mode, effects and criticality analysis (FMECA) at module level
* Manage your tasks to meet performance, schedule and budget targets
* Investigate new solutions to improve performance, manufacturability and reliability
* Support procurement activities including component and supplier selection, manufacturing and factory acceptance testing
* Perform assembly and testing of systems in our machine hall
* Support assembly, testing, and pilot installations in the field



**Skills and qualifications** 



* You have 3+ years of relevant experience from designing mechanical systems & industrial equipment
* You have a BSc or a MSc. degree in mechanical engineering or related disciplines, but your personality, experience and interest in the field is the most important.


* You have proven end-to-end development - design, build, test and release - across multiple projects


* You have a broad technical knowledge and genuine interest in the different aspects of machinery and mechanical design. Knowledge of mooring, gearbox technology, pneumatics, hydraulics, structural optimization, fabrication, sensors, and/or electricity generation equipment is qualifying. Experience in design and analysis of welded frames and working to the machine directive (2006/42/EC) is highly valued.


* You have experience working with Creo CAD, Windchill PLM and ANSYS for structural analysis (or equivalent tools with willingness to get up to speed)


* You are proficient in English, both spoken and written, have strong communication skills and the ability to work in a small, agile team.



**As a person:** 



* You are striving for excellence, put quality into everything you do
* You are self-motivated and love to optimise your time
* You actively seek out ways to improve both your own and the teams’ working methods
* You always search for the most sustainable solutions to difficult problems
* You love to learn new things, and take pride in constantly developing your skills
* You are innovative, solution-oriented & persistent, knowing it takes stamina to reach pioneering goals
* You see your tasks through to completion
* You are comfortable in presenting your solutions internally and externally
* You are data driven and strive to always back your points with solid research



 CorPower Ocean has a highly diversified team with many nationalities and backgrounds, all working towards the same goal. This is something we are very proud of. We are not perfect yet, but we hope you share our aim to reach a higher equality.

title: Cyber Security - Incident Manager
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **4+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

 Rollbeskrivning:
   

  

 Vi söker för vår kund i Stockholm en Säkerhetsansvarig/Incident manager
   

  

 Som Säkerhetsansvarig / Incident Manager ansvarar du för att hantera och utveckla organisationens säkerhetsarbete, både operativt och strategiskt. Rollen kombinerar incidenthantering i det dagliga arbetet med långsiktigt förbättrings- och utvecklingsarbete av processer, verktyg och tjänster inom cybersäkerhet.
   

  

**Operativa uppgifter:**
* Hantera dagliga säkerhetsincidenter för att upprätthålla verksamhetens kontinuitet.
* Arbeta nära IT-serviceägare och affärsenheter för att lösa incidenter.
* Ta ansvar vid större säkerhetsincidenter och koordinera involverade funktioner.
* Säkerställa att processer följs och att återkommande incidenter utreds och hanteras.
* Följa säkerhetstrender och agera proaktivt.


**Strategiska uppgifter:**
* Driva långsiktiga förbättringar av processer och säkerhetsfunktioner.
