title: Senior Tech Partner & Implementation Manager
description:
The
 **Senior Tech Partner & Implementation Manager** 
 plays a pivotal role in driving technological innovations and solutions for digital marketing across TUI.
 



 As a key bridge between digital marketing operations and technology teams, this role ensures successful implementation of digital strategies, optimising efficiency and enhancing customer experiences.
 



 This position is critical to TUI’s digital transformation journey, supporting scalable performance marketing solutions in a high-growth, global context. The role also owns the commercial and contractual relationships with TUI’s key marketing technology partners such as Google, Meta, Smartly and others – ensuring contracts, SLAs and renewals are managed effectively and in alignment with Procurement, Legal and Data Protection teams. It leads the preparation and coordination of Joint Business Plans (JBPs) and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) across all markets, driving accountability, partnership value, and compliance in execution.
 



***Become part of our team - applications open! This role will be advertised for a minimum of 14 days but could close anytime after this time so don't delay!***




**About Our Offer** 



* Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, bonus opportunity, exclusive travel perks & discounts, extensive health & wellbeing support, and more.
* Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer hybrid or remote working models.
* A career to shape: Opportunities to upskill, reskill and grow your career. Access the TUI Tech Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
* Expand your horizons: Participate in our tech communities and collaborate on global projects and teams.
* Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation and the Sustainable Tech Community.



**About The Job** 



* Collaborate with relevant stakeholders in IT and across the regions to define ultimate technology roadmap for digital marketing solutions aligned with business objectives.
* Implement end to end delivery of technology solutions, ensuring seamless integration into E2E aligned operational processes with all the regions and adjoining departments.
* Partner with teams in operations, marketing, finance, and customer service to identify tech-driven efficiencies, Solutions need to be connected with other (internal & external) systems and be fed with all the necessary data
* Lead cross-functional implementation projects from planning to post-launch optimization with full implementation in all regions
* Own and manage contractual relationships and partner operations with key global vendors (Google, Meta, Smartly, etc.), coordinating with Procurement, Legal, and Data Protection to ensure all solutions and agreements meet TUI’s compliance, privacy, and governance standards
* Lead and coordinate Joint Business Plans (JBPs), Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs), and related partner reporting and administrative processes to ensure consistency and strategic alignment across all markets.
* Maintain relationships with third-party technology providers, like Google, Meta, negotiating service agreements to maximize performance
* Utilise analytics and key performance metrics to refine digital strategies. Set standards for reporting and monitor performance to define actions for improvement
* Drive user adoption and engagement by implementing effective training programs for all stakeholders in regions and stakeholder communication strategies
* Ensure technological implementations align with regulatory and security standards.



**About You** 



* Demonstratable experience in technology implementation and digital transformation roles
* Proven experience in leading large-scale projects within corporate environments, ideally within the travel industry
* Strong experience managing external technology vendors and owning global contracts, renewals, and SLAs
* Experience with cloud-based systems and digital tools
* Strong knowledge of industry trends and emerging technologies
* Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills, able to develop trusted working relationships across business boundaries
* Exceptional commercial acumen with a target-driven approach and passion for implementing data-driven ideas to maximize growth
* Solid understanding of data privacy, governance, and compliance frameworks (GDPR, platform consent models) and ability to align external partners to these requirements
* Exceptional communication skills, able to translate data into easy-to-understand insights and clearly communicate performance to stakeholders at all levels
* Ability to build presentations that condense data into easy-to-understand insights and recommendations



 From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.
 



 We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

title: Nätsäkerhetsspecialist / Nätsäkerhetsarkitekt
description:
På HiQ söker vi dig som brinner för nätverk och säkerhet, och som vill ta nästa steg i en miljö där teknik och kreativitet går hand i hand. Tänk dig att kliva in på jobbet och direkt få ta dig an nätverk som spänner över allt från stora datacenter till molnlösningar, där varje dag bjuder på nya tekniska utmaningar och möjligheter att utvecklas.. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta med allt från design och implementation till drift av nät- och säkerhetslösningar i miljöer där både teknikdjup och innovation står i centrum.
   

  

**Du kommer att…**
* Jobba med allt från switching, routing och wifi i både klassiska och moderna nätverksmiljöer: on-prem, cloud och hybrid. Du är med och bygger robusta lösningar med SDWAN, VPN och lastbalansering, och optimerar nätverk.
* Få arbeta med brandväggar, IDS/IPS, proxy, loggning och PKI. Du använder programmering och automation för att effektivisera och utveckla nätverket. Du får också jobba i virtualiserade och containerbaserade miljöer som VMWare och Docker, och testa nya teknologier när de dyker upp.
* Arbeta med lösningar från flera leverantörer som Cisco, Juniper, HPE/Aruba, Palo Alto, Fortinet och Azure. Certifieringar är meriterande, men viktigast är din vilja att utvecklas och lära nytt.
* Utveckla och förvalta nätverkslösningar som möter dagens krav och banar väg för framtiden. Du samarbetar tätt med kollegor och kunder, får utrymme att testa idéer, utforska ny teknik och vässa din kompetens – oavsett om det gäller SDWAN, datacenter, cloud eller nätverkssäkerhet.


**Vi tror att du:**
* Har minst tre års erfarenhet av nätverk och säkerhet i större organisationer, och att du trivs med att kombinera hands-on-arbete med strategiskt tänkande.
* Är van att navigera mellan olika teknologier och leverantörer, och ser möjligheter där andra ser hinder.
* Talar och skriver svenska obehindrat och har en nyfikenhet som driver dig att hela tiden lära mer.


**Varför HiQ?**
 Sedan 1995 har HiQ hjälpt kunder och användare att göra livet enklare med teknik, design och kommunikation. Vi har alltid haft två fokus: att ha roligt på jobbet och att leverera bättre lösningar än förväntat – det är det som driver oss! Som HiQ:are är vi stolta över vår kultur där resultat, ansvar, enkelhet och glädje står i centrum. Vi tror på samarbete för att nå gemensamma mål och på att stötta varandra att växa. Här får du inte bara utveckla din egen kompetens, utan också chansen att lära av, leda och inspirera dina kollegor.
   

  

 Låter det spännande? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt nätverk – vi ser fram emot att höra hur du vill bidra till vår gemensamma resa!

title: Client Executive - Aviation
description:
***This job is with WTW, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 Do you have passion for building enduring client relationships and delivering tailored solutions?
   

  

 WTW is growing and following our success we are now expanding the Aviation team with a Client Executive having experience within aviation insurance solutions. This is a great opportunity to join a growth journey in an international company, working with the most exciting clients in the Nordics.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As our new Client Executive , you have responsibility for managing the client relationship and delivering profitability. You leverage WTW resources to provide coordinated service and placement to meet the client’s insurance and risk management needs. The successful candidate will have responsibility for a portfolio of accounts handling all aspects of clients’ insurance programs within aviation in a timely, technically, accurate and compliant manner. This will include but not be restricted to new business enquiries; client renewals; and broking.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Qualifications**
* Experienced in aviation industry and/or insurance within broking, underwriting and/or claims, with knowledge of the markets, risks, and products.
* You understand the aviation industry and can translate this understanding into tailored client insurance solutions based on their risk profile, demonstrating a keen interest in aviation and a commitment to continuous learning.
* You are experienced in advising clients and have a proven track record in building strong, long-term relationships with clients.
* In previous roles, you have demonstrated strong consultative and educational skills, adept at working independently and collaboratively with a strong analytical and methodical approach. Your readiness to contribute whenever and wherever necessary marks your attitude.


**About WTW**
 WTW (NASDAQ: WLTW) is a leading global insurance brokerage and risk consulting company. With roots dating back to 1828, WTW has 47,000 employees in more than 140 countries and markets.
   

  

 Through local presence and expertise, WTW is a global company who can offer tailor-made solutions adapted to the customer's risks and needs, local trends, markets, and legislation. Through knowledge, professionalism, commitment, and customer focus, we help customers around the world turn risk into growth opportunities.
   

  

 In Sweden, we are one of the country's top advisers in risk and insurance mediation in non-life insurance, pension and compensation solutions and actuarial services (life and property). We are approximately 200 employees in Stockholm (HK), Gothenburg and Malmö.
   

  

 We Transform Tomorrows
   

  

**WTW is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Contract Manager - IT SW and Services
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Ericsson Cloud Software & Services (BCSS) delivers cloud-native solutions for 5G Core, Automation and AI, Managed Services, and OSS/BSS. Our customers are Communications Service Providers (CSPs), commonly known as telecom operators, who are adopting 5G, cloud, and AI to build resilient networks, create new services, and monetize them. BCSS is a global team of about 30,000 people serving customers in 180+ countries.
   

  

 You will join Tactical & Contract Engagement (T&CE) which is a team within BCSS Sales and Commercial Management. In your role, you will focus on servicing one of the BCSS Solution Areas: Business & Operations Support Systems (SA BOS) and their GTM strategy from a contract management perspective. SA BOS designs and delivers software and IT solutions that help telecom operators run their business and networks more efficiently, including tools for managing customers, billing, and network operations, available as ready-made products or customized services.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 As a Contract Manager you will
   

  

 develop contractual assets & guidance that define best practice for deployment by our local Contract Management teams, develop and deliver engaging training in mixed mode to various stakeholder communities, and support local teams with drafting and negotiation assistance on critical deals. This will involve:
   

  

* Acting as change agent to support evolution in contracting approach for SA BOS, executing a more IT-style of contracting and engagement than Ericsson’s traditional telco base.
* Evolving Contracting Templates in support of SA BOS strategic direction
* Supporting evolution of SA BOS Portfolio from a contracting perspective, articulating the contractual guiderails and clauses needed for new offerings with new technology base & risk profile (e.g., aaS, AI content)
* Developing & evolving guidance (e.g. golden rules, model clause examples etc.) and embed this in practice by providing training & workshops to the BA & MA communities to support continual development and improve contract discipline
* Acting as BCSS Contract Management SME & provide support to wider Sales and Commercial Management & SA BOS Teams and assigned geographies on selected customer engagements, includes supporting customer negotiation
* Harvesting good practice examples aligned to strategy across assigned MA(s)
* Guiding and assisting on interpretation of contractual clauses and obligations as required by the business with reference to Group Legal. Includes recommendations to BCSS Head of Sales & Commercial Management on escalated deviations from Ericsson wanted positions.
* Providing Contract Management expertise into other SCM projects and programs


**The skills you bring:**
 For this role we are looking for a Contract Manager with a proven track record of success in contract management with strong prior experience in IT services projects & engagements.
   

  

 In addition we expect you to have:
   

  

* Awareness of contractual and business law and ability to deliver high quality contract drafting
* Ability to support negotiations, ideally be able to lead contractual negotiation and customer discussion
* Ability to communicate & influence at senior level
* Creative, innovative mind-set to develop well thought-through approaches and overcome contractual challenges
* Confidence to work self-managed in a fast paced and exciting environment
* WorldCC / IACCM certification or equivalent is a plus
* Proficiency in English both written and oral is a must, additional multiple languages are a plus


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 774129

title: Data Scientist TRATON Financial Services
description:
At TRATON Financial Services (TFS) we have started the journey to become the provider of Financial Services to all TRATON brands. Service include financing for customers, dealers, and distributors as well as insurance solutions. With a presence in over 65 markets, we are already one of the most global actors in the financial services industry and rapidly growing. Do you want to be part of this journey?
   

  

 TFS Analytics serves as the headquarter function for data, analytics, and AI across the Group.
   

  

 We:
   

  

  

* Provide data as a utility to the organization
* Offer insight and analytic services through self-service and governed data platforms
* Drive business value via scalable data products, AI, and automation


 You will collaborate closely with headquarter stakeholders and business units globally, shaping how data and analytics fuel smarter, more sustainable financial and operational decisions.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are looking for two Data Scientists to join our growing team at TFS Analytics, each with a slightly different focus but a shared mission to transform data into business value.
   

  

 Both roles are hands-on and involve working across the analytics lifecycle, from data exploration to model deployment, in collaboration with data engineers, BI developers, and domain experts.
   

  

 Depending on your background and interests, you may fit one of the following focuses or ideally, both.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 Business & Analytics Focus
   

  

 You are passionate about connecting business needs with data insights. You love turning complex datasets into clear narratives and actionable recommendations that influence business outcomes.
   

  

 You will work closely with financial and operational teams to uncover trends, design dashboards, and deliver analytical solutions that guide decision-making across the organization.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

  

* Engage with business stakeholders to identify analytic opportunities and define success metrics.
* Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) and create impactful data visualizations.
* Develop descriptive and diagnostic models that enhance financial, risk, and performance analysis.
* Design and deliver self-service dashboards using tools like Power BI.
* Translate data findings into clear business recommendations and present them effectively to diverse audiences.
* Contribute to improving data literacy and promoting a data-driven culture across TFS.


 Ideal Profile
   

  

  

* Strong technical skills in SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (Power BI or similar).
* Experience in data modeling, business analytics, and reporting.
* Proven ability to connect data insights with business impact.
* Experience with Snowflake, dbt, or similar cloud data platforms is an advantage.
* Prior exposure to financial services, risk modeling, or customer analytics is a plus.


**Who You Are**
 You are excited by the power of advanced analytics, machine learning, and generative AI, agentic AI to shape the future of financial services.
   

  

 You thrive on building, deploying, and scaling intelligent data products from predictive models to GenAI-powered assistants and autonomous analytics agents.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who enjoys exploring new AI frontiers, applying creativity to technology, and working hands-on with modern ML and AI stacks.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

  

* Design, develop, and deploy predictive, prescriptive, and generative AI models to solve real business problems.
* Explore and implement LLM-based (Large Language Model) solutions, such as Generative AI chatbots, document intelligence systems, or Agentic AI tools that can reason, act, and automate workflows.
* Collaborate with data engineers to ensure scalable data pipelines and efficient model deployment.
* Integrate AI models and agents into business applications and digital platforms.
* Develop and maintain reusable frameworks for MLOps, LLMOps, and continuous model improvement.
* Partner with domain experts to ensure responsible AI practices, focusing on accuracy, fairness, and explainability.
* Stay current with emerging AI technologies, contributing to TFS’s AI roadmap and innovation strategy.


 Ideal Profile
   

  

  

* Solid programming skills in Python and experience with machine learning frameworks.
* Experience working with Generative AI, LLMs (e.g., OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, or open-source models), and Agentic AI frameworks.
* Understanding of MLOps, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud-based AI services.
* Strong foundation in data engineering concepts, feature design, and model lifecycle management.


 Common Traits Across Both Roles
   

  

  

* MSc or equivalent in Computer Science, Data Science, AI/ML, or related field.
* Experience handling large, complex datasets and modern data platforms.
* Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving orientation.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complexity.
* Collaborative, curious, and motivated by creating end-to-end value from data.


**TRATON Financial Services Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TFS supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include amongst other training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, an attractive company profit sharing program, flexible hours and work places, and company car leasing. The group also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-10-04. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check is required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Bei Qiu, Head of Data Analytics and AI, bei.qiu@tratonfs.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**
**This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON Financial Services**
**#TFS**

title: Data Lead
description:
**Join Telavox as a Data Lead 📈 🚀**
 Are you a strategic, technically-minded leader who turns complex data into actionable insights? At Telavox, we’re building the future of Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS), and we’re looking for a Data Lead to shape our Data Platform strategy, ensuring it’s scalable, reliable, and delivers value for both internal teams and Operator customers.
   

  

 We combine the reliability of telecom with the agility of SaaS, and we’re growing fast globally.
   

  

 A Data Lead at Telavox does more than manage pipelines; they define data strategy, shape architecture, deliver high-quality data products, and mentor teams.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a Data Lead at Telavox, you will own the strategy and roadmap for our central Data Platform. You will lead the transition to a modern, event-driven architecture, ensure operational continuity for Finance and other key teams, and deliver curated, high-quality data products for both internal stakeholders and Operator customers. In this role, you will collaborate closely with BI & Analytics, Product, and Engineering teams, while leading and mentoring a team of Data Engineers to drive excellence across our data initiatives.
   

  

**Your Day-to-day Work May Include**
* Defining and owning the long-term vision and roadmap for Telavox’s Data Platform, including data modeling and governance frameworks
* Leading the shift from a fragmented data landscape to a modern, event-driven platform
* Ensuring operational continuity for Finance processes and delivering critical usage, billing, and CDR data
* Building scalable data streaming APIs for Operator customers
* Collaborating with stakeholders to provide curated, user-centric Data Products
* Monitoring platform performance, data quality, and adoption metrics
* Leading, mentoring, and growing the technical capabilities of the Data Platform team


 This role is based at our new vibrant HQ called Gjuteriet, in Västra Hamnen, Malmö.
   

  

**About You**
 You are a visionary and hands-on leader who can turn complex data challenges into strategic advantages. You bridge the gap between business needs and technical execution, and you thrive on building reliable, high-value data solutions.
   

  

**Key Skills And Experience We’re Looking For**
* Proven leadership experience managing technical teams (Data Engineers/Software Engineers)
* Deep expertise in modern data architecture, cloud platforms (GCP preferred), streaming technologies (Debezium/PubSub/Kafka), and data transformation tools (dbt/Dataform), and data warehousing technologies (BigQuery)
* Experience with data governance, quality, and secure platform operations
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
* Familiarity with Telco data (usage, billing, CDR) is a plus


 You are proactive, structured, and ready to turn Telavox’s data into a strategic asset that drives growth and operational excellence.
   

  

****Join us at Telavox 💚****
 Since Telavox's journey started in 2002, we have strengthened our position as the leading forward-thinking communication platform for businesses. As a digital mobile operator, we develop and own our all-in-one communication platform, which integrates telephony, PBX, messaging, meetings, and contact centers, giving businesses a smarter way to connect.
   

  

 Today, we’re a thriving company with 1.9 billion SEK in revenue and 500+ Telavoxers across nine countries. We embrace AI and automation to push the boundaries of business communication.
   

  

 We offer flexible work options and adaptable hours, giving you the freedom to balance life and career while staying connected to our vibrant Telavox culture.
   

  

**How to apply!**
 At Telavox, we don't focus on fitting in; we focus on making room for everyone.
   

  

 We’re always on the lookout for great talent, so applications are reviewed continuously. If you're ready to be part of an innovative, AI-driven telecom company, apply today with your CV and cover letter in English.
   

  

 For any questions, feel free to reach out to Talent Acquisition Partner Ami Faraguna at ann-marie.faraguna@telavox.com
   

  

  

  

**Learn more about what we do! ⬇️**
 Telavox develops world-leading communications platforms with solutions for smart and efficient telephony, PBX, chat and much more. Regardless of whether it involves an entrepreneur-driven startup or a giant among giants, Telavox contributes to making companies more transparent, efficient and accessible.

title: Account Manager
description:
Are you a professional in account management within a tech or SaaS environment who’s comfortable discussing processes, integrations, and data flows — and enjoys becoming an expert in a complex system to turn that expertise into actionable advice for customers? Join one of Europe’s most established HR tech companies, Sympa, and help us accelerate our growth across the Nordics.
 



  





 Type: Full-time, permanent
 



 Location: Stockholm, Sweden (hybrid)
 



 Starting date: Negotiable
 



  





 Over the last 20 years, Sympa has helped some of the largest companies in the Nordics to put people at the centre of their strategy. With 1,000 customers and a strong install base, we’re on a mission to continue growing. To join us on our journey, we are now looking for an Account Manager to take care of our current customers, specifically in the Swedish market.
 



  





 As an Account Manager, you’ll play a key role in ensuring our customers get the very best out of the Sympa platform. You’ll manage a portfolio of accounts, act as their trusted partner, and work closely with both customers and colleagues to strengthen long-term relationships. While the role can be fast-paced and hands-on, it also gives you the chance to spot opportunities for growth and deepen customer value over time.
 



  





 What you get to do every day
 



 • Be the main point of contact for your own portfolio of customers and take care of those relationships
 



 • Help customers get the most value from Sympa’s solutions, making sure they feel supported and satisfied
 



 • Spot and prevent churn risks by staying close to customer needs and taking proactive actions
 



 • Look out for opportunities to grow the partnership by introducing additional products or services
 



 • Handle practical processes, such as price corrections and contract updates, in a smooth and professional way
 



 • Build trust with people across customer organizations, from daily users to decision-makers
 



 • Work side by side with colleagues in Sales, Marketing, Product, and Services to create smooth customer experiences
 



 • Share insights and collaborate with other customer-facing teams to make our customer work even better
 



 • Become an expert in the Sympa platform — a complex, evolving system — and use that expertise to provide customers with practical, actionable advice.
 



  





 What do we offer?
 



 Sympa is striving for fast international growth while maintaining the agility of a small business, which shapes our work culture. Decisions are made fast, with a flat hierarchy. We are united by a shared purpose: driving success together while having the freedom to innovate, grow, and make a real impact.
 



  





 As an Account Manager, you will get
 



 • The chance to contribute to Sympa’s success directly through your own work
 



 • An independent and valued role within a team of highly skilled professionals, with the chance to grow along with your responsibilities in an ambitious working environment
 



 • To work at a modern, international and fast-growing company and collaborate with colleagues across countries daily
 



 • Opportunity to become a master of Sympa — learn the system inside and out and act as a trusted advisor
 



  





 If you’re looking for a friendly yet driven environment where collaboration meets accountability, you’ll fit right in.
 



  





 What do we value in our candidates?
 



 We’re looking for someone with a proven track record of successfully managing end-to-end customer relationships in a B2B tech or SaaS environment. You have a technical mindset and experience managing customer relationships involving complex systems. With your collaborative mindset and ability to build trust, you’ll help us and our customers succeed.
 



  





 Furthermore, the following experience and skills are needed to succeed
 



 • Experience in account management in a tech or SaaS environment, working with complex software and helping customers make the most of it
 



 • Professional fluency in Swedish and English, other Nordic languages considered an advantage
 



 • Strong communication and negotiation skills
 



 • A customer-first mindset with the ability to build and maintain long-term relationships
 



 • Confidence in handling account processes such as renewals, churn prevention, and price corrections
 



 • A proactive and organized way of working — able to manage multiple accounts and tasks at once
 



 • A collaborative team player who enjoys working with colleagues across different functions
 



 • Curiosity and willingness to learn the Sympa platform inside out
 



  





 Additionally, we value a consultative approach and a genuine interest in understanding our customers’ business and challenges. Our solution is a complex SaaS product, and we’re looking for someone who not only drives commercial success but also enjoys advising and guiding customers on how to make the most of our platform.
 



  





 Got your attention?
 



 Great! Send us your application via the system to introduce yourself. The position will be filled as soon as we find the right candidate. If you have any questions about the role, you can contact our hiring manager for this position:
 



  





 Mikko Takkinen
 



 CS Director
 



 mikko.takkinen@sympa.com

title: Systemintegratör för mjukvaruprojekt
description:
På Sylog letar vi efter erfarna integratörer, testare eller mjukvaruutvecklare som är redo att engagera sig i betydelsefulla projekt hos vår kund.
   

  

 Som integratör hos Sylog får du chansen att arbeta i hjärtat av innovation inom säkerhetskritiska sektorer. Vi erbjuder en transparens och teknikdriven arbetsmiljö där det finns gott om utrymme för personlig och professionell tillväxt. Med kunskap, passion och frihet som våra ledord, är vår ambition att du ska känna att du kan påverka både din karriär och ditt privatliv i så stor utsträckning som möjligt. Eftersom vi vet att balans och nöjdhet leder till bättre prestationer.
   

  

 Som anställd konsult hos Sylog kommer du att få engagera dig i högteknologiska produkter och komplexa system som utmanar och utvecklar din expertis. Uppdragen är av långsiktig karaktär och när det väl är dags att testa något nytt, ger vår breda kundbas dig flera vägar att utforska.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
 I rollen som integratör kommer du att hantera mångsidiga uppgifter relaterade till att utveckla, underhålla och optimera systemens bygg- och utvecklingsmiljöer hos kund. Du kommer att hantera integration av både hård- och mjukvarukomponenter i kundens plattformar.
   

  

 För att lyckas i denna roll bör du ha en god förståelse för samspelet mellan mjukvara och hårdvara. Du är en kommunikativ person som trivs i samarbeten med både kollegor och kunder. Ditt arbete kommer att innefatta direkt samarbete med slutkunder för att säkerställa en smidig och effektiv implementering och driftsättning av systemen. Du bidrar även med värdefull teknisk vägledning och stöttning till utvecklarna för att kunna säkerställa kvalitet samt effektiviteten i projektet.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet från projekt som ställer höga krav på prestanda, skalbarhet och säkerhet.
* Akademisk bakgrund inom datorsystem, elektronik eller motsvarande.
* God förståelse för komplexa systemmiljöer.
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom programmering och felsökning, python är önskvärt.
* Tidigare erfarenhet inom system och funktionstest.
* Du är strukturerad och noggrann med en stark kvalitetsmedvetenhet.
* Erfarenhet inom både Installation och drift.
* God kommunikativ förmåga och flytande i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.
* Svenskt medborgarskap.
* Minst 5 års relevant erfarenhet


 Erfarenhet av att arbeta inom någon eller flera av dessa områden är önskvärt:
   

  

* Telecom
* Fordon
* Medtech
* Försvar
* Flyg
* Tåg


**Varför Sylog?**
 På Sylog förstår vi att våra medarbetare är hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Därför är det självklart att vår verksamhet är inriktad på att stödja och främja din utveckling. Hos oss blir du en del av ett personalfokuserat konsultbolag med korta beslutsvägar och ger dig goda möjligheter att påverka din egen anställning och möjligheten att bidra med idéer till Sylogs växande verksamhet. Vi driver utvecklingen framåt för både branschen och våra kunders långsiktiga behov.
   

  

 Följande saker är exempel på vad du som anställd kan förvänta dig:
   

  

* Transparens, flexibilitet och stort självbestämmande kring din anställning och val av uppdrag.
* Stabil, lyhörd och initiativdriven organisation.
* Låg personalomsättning.
* Marknadsmässig lön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och diverse försäkringar.
* Stort nätverk, omfattande kundbas med direktkontakter och ett dedikerat säljteam.
* Generösa möjligheter till sociala och kompetensutvecklande aktiviteter under året.
* Årliga konferensresor.


 💡
 **Vill du ha ytterligare information? Vi vill gärna höra från dig!**

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**About WPP Media**
 WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.
   

  

 WPP Media is WPP’s global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com.
   

  

**Role**
 At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people. It’s what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media’s shared core values:
   

  

* Be Extraordinary by Leading Collectively to Inspire transformational Creativity.
* Create an Open environment by Balancing People and Client Experiences by Cultivating Trust.
* Lead Optimistically by Championing Growth and Development to Mobilize the Enterprise.


**Role Summary And Impact**
 We are now looking for a Senior Data Scientist who is eager to take a key role in shaping and driving our success going forward. In this role you will take a leading part in growing our clients and improving our models and output.
   

  

 The person we are looking for is a leader that is equally in love with solving hard marketing problems using data, consulting the largest and most demanding brands and companies in Sweden, and mentoring a growing a team of analytical super stars.
   

  

 Choreograph is WPP’s data and technology company. We connect the world’s data to help leading advertisers create greater business impact and deliver more growth. In Sweden, Choreograph operates as part of WPP Media, bringing together four departments: Analytics, Insights, Data Strategy, and Data & Tech Consulting. The role we are recruiting for is based in Analytics.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll join a group of experienced data scientists and marketing consultants who thrive on innovation, collaboration, and driving results.
   

  

**Skills And Experience**
 We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our growing team in Stockholm. In this role, you will work with:
   

  

* As your main task you will help our clients understand and measure the true impact of their marketing investment using measurement tools, including Marketing Mix Modelling. Your role will involve packaging and presenting these findings in a compelling way to engage and inform C-level client stakeholders at some of the biggest companies in the Nordics.
* You will also work hands-on, guide and steer colleagues to transform technical outputs - such as outputs from Python models - into clear, actionable insights. You will work on projects involving attribution modeling, experiments, and algorithm development, while also contributing to the development of automated reporting tools and other innovative data science initiatives.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Business administration or similar
* Business mind-set and experience from marketing and media
* Excellent storytelling and communication skills, ability to explain technical issues and solutions to non-technical people
* Programming (we use Python as our main coding language)
* Expert level in statistics
* Experience using Cloud, SQL, GIT, PowerBI or similar relevant technologies
* You are fluent in both Swedish and English
* You have excellent skills in Excel and Powerpoint


**Life At WPP Media & Benefits**
 Our passion for shaping the next era of media includes investing in our employees to help them do their best work, and we’re just as committed to employee growth as we are to responsible media investment. WPP Media employees can tap into the global WPP Media & WPP networks to pursue their passions, grow their networks, and learn at the cutting edge of marketing and advertising.
   

  

 In Sweden, our benefits include a SEK 3,000 wellness allowance, a 37,5-hour workweek, half-days and “klämdagar" off, 30 days of vacation, and two paid volunteer days per year. WPP Media Sweden is a member of Almega, and all employees are covered by a collective bargaining agreement (kollektivavtal), which ensures occupational pension, insurance, and other negotiated terms. We host regular team activities, knowledge-sharing sessions, and wellness initiatives throughout the year.
   

  

 WPP Media is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.
   

  

  

  

 We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.
   

  

**Application**
 This is a full-time permanent position with a start date as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period.  Please note that this role requires that you have the legal right to work in Sweden.
   

  

 In addition to reviewing your CV and conducting interviews, our recruitment process includes a testing phase. Selection and interviews are ongoing, so please submit your application with your CV and cover letter as soon as possible.
   

  

 We believe that diverse perspectives make us stronger and encourage applications from people of all genders, backgrounds, and experiences.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the position, feel free to contact Elias Betinakis, Country Lead Choreograph at elias.betinakis@wppmedia.com. Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email.
   

  

 Please read our Privacy Notice for more information on how we process the information you provide.

title: Marketing Technology Architect
description:
The Marketing Technology Architect is the marketing technology brain of TUI's performance organisation.
 



 This role ensures that advertising and marketing systems (CDP, feeds, tracking, GMP, Meta, Smartly, etc.) are effectively connected into internal data and product platforms like OneWeb and the App, while also aligning with local market workflows and campaign processes.It safeguards interoperability, drives innovation, and enables scaled, data-driven marketing across all markets.
 



 This role is highly technical and hands-on, focused on the connective tissue between platforms. It defines how tools interact at a system level and gives clear architectural recommendations on how new platforms and features should be integrated into the wider ecosystem.Beyond technical oversight, the MarTech Architect plays a leading role in shaping how individual systems snap into each other and how activation at scale can be achieved.
 



 The role is expected to own the architectural design for complex projects and ensure they are implemented in the most scalable and compliant way possible. The MarTech Architect plays a central role in reducing technical friction, enabling automation, and scaling campaign-ready integrations across the group.
 



***Become part of our team - applications open! This role will be advertised for a minimum of 14 days but could close anytime after this time so don't delay!***




**About Our Offer** 



* Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, bonus opportunity, exclusive travel perks & discounts, extensive health & wellbeing support, and more.
* Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer hybrid or remote working models.
* A career to shape: Opportunities to upskill, reskill and grow your career. Access the TUI Tech Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
* Expand your horizons: Participate in our tech communities and collaborate on global projects and teams.
* Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation and the Sustainable Tech Community.



**About The Job** 



* Own and evolve the blueprint for marketing technology systems to enable seamless, cross-channel campaign execution across TUI
* Ensure tools for paid media, tagging, analytics, feeds, and audience activation are well connected to each other and to core platforms like OneWeb and the TUI App
* Build reusable infrastructure and integration logic that reduces friction in launching new campaigns or use cases
* Scout and introduce AI tools or automation workflows that help markets increase campaign precision and reduce manual workload
* Design infrastructure that respects local differences while aligning to shared standards and tooling
* Anticipate regulatory and platform changes (e.g. cookies, API rules) and design future-safe integrations
* Bridge the gap between business needs and technical execution by working across Marketing Ops, IT, Data, and local teams
* Maintain central knowledge base and playbooks to support faster onboarding, rollout, and troubleshooting
* Define and lead architectural approaches for new platform implementations and ensure alignment with internal systems, data flows, and campaign delivery goals.Be the go-to person for technical decisions and system-level design discussions, especially where platforms intersect.



**About You** 



* Strong experience in marketing technology architecture, preferably in matrixed/global organisations
* Knowledge of internal platform integration (OneWeb, App, DWHs) and how these feed into campaign delivery
* Familiarity with APIs, server/client-side tracking, consent frameworks, cleanrooms, automation stacks
* Technical mindset with strong systems thinking: you understand how platforms interact, where complexity hides, and how to simplify it without losing functionality
* Experience bridging technical and business stakeholders
* Ability to define scalable system architectures and produce high-quality technical documentation that informs implementation teams
* Ability to document complex systems into easy-to-use reference guide
* Comfortable working in cross-market, cross-functional project environments



 From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.
 



 We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

title: Channel Lead Impulse
description:
**Vill du vara med och bli en nyckelspelare inom en spännande och växande kategori?
   

  

 Vi på Red Bull växer och investerar i vårt KAM team. Därför går vi från en Head of KAM till två Channel Lead roller, Channel Lead Impulse och Channel Lead Retail, som tillsammans ansvarar för att leda våra kommersiella och strategiska samarbeten med våra kunder.**
 Rollen som Channel Lead Impulse är en viktig ledarroll där du är ansvarig för att skapa vinnande och växande kundplaner, starka kundrelationer samt utveckla ett högpresterande team av Key Account Managers. Du kommer arbeta nära funktioner som Field Sales, Trade Marketing, Category Management, Operations och Finance för att skapa effektiva strategier för optimalt genomförande i butik. Tillsammans med Channel Lead Retail ansvarar du för att företagets Key Account Managers arbetar och planerar på ett harmoniserat sätt samt delar lärdomar och kunskap över kanalgränserna.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för kanalens P&L där arbete med pris- och kampanjstrategi, trade terms management och portföljmix blir viktiga delar för att kunna växa lönsamt tillsammans med kund framåt. I denna roll får du chansen att påverka, både internt och externt. Du blir en viktig spelare i att forma vår affärsstrategi och driva fortsatt tillväxt i en konkurrensintensiv och spännande kategori.
   

  

 Du får arbeta i en dynamisk organisation med högt tempo, där entreprenörskap, innovation och samarbete står i fokus. Rollen ingår i Off Premise ledningsgrupp där ni tillsammans ansvarar för att fatta strategiska beslut och skapa förutsättningar för att Red Bulls affärsmål uppnås på ett effektivt sätt. Är du redo att anta utmaningen? Sök nu och bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team! Urval sker löpande, sista ansökningsdatum är 30:e november.
   

  

**De ansvarsområden som vi anförtror dig:**
**STRATEGISKT OCH NYTÄNKANDE LEDARSKAP**
 Tillsammans med Channel Lead Retail, utveckla och implementera en Key Account-strategi som är i linje med Red Bulls övergripande mål. Leda, motivera och coacha ditt team till att nå uppsatta mål och skapa en kultur av ansvarstagande och ständig förbättring. Med stor nyfikenhet, kreativt mindset samt mod, identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter som kan driva tillväxt inom kategorin över tid.
   

  

**BYGGA STARKA KUNDRELATIONER SAMT INTERNT ENGAGEMANG**
 Stort intresse och förmåga för att bygga nya, likväl som att utveckla och vårda många befintliga, relationer. Coacha dina medarbetare att skapa och utveckla långsiktiga, förtroendefulla relationer med våra kunder. Internt fungera som ledaren och språkröret för Impulse kanalen, vilket innebär att du driver och ansvarar för Impulse agenda gentemot övriga team internt och externt.
   

  

**KOMMERSIALLA RESULTAT**
 Ha fullt ansvar för Key Accounts kundavtal samt P&L som förväntas leverera på nyckeltal som försäljning, marginal, marknadsandel och distributionstillväxt. I samarbete med Business Insights och Category Manager, använda shopper-insikter och kategoridata för att ligga i framkant hos kund med innovativa och framåtlutade kundplaner som tar både vår och kundens totala försäljning till nästa nivå.
   

  

**TVÄRFUNKTIONELLT SAMARBETE**
 Jobba tight med interna avdelningar som Field Sales, Trade Marketing, Category Management, Operations och Finance för att skapa rätt förutsättningar för oss att prestera ihop med våra kunder. Du förväntas kunna navigera självständigt och självsäkert mot övriga intressenter i bolaget, exempelvis det globala KAM teamet i Österrike.
   

  

**Dina tidigare erfarenheter Du kan visa prov på:**
* Minst 5-7 års erfarenhet från kommersiella roller inom FMCG och/eller gärna från Impulse- eller Gas & convenience-segmentet. Meriterande om du har erfarenhet från energidryckskategorin.
* Erfarenhet av att leda och utveckla team.
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga och ett naturligt sätt att bygga förtroendefulla relationer snabbt.
* Du har ett entreprenöriellt mindset och är van att driva projekt från idé till genomförande såväl internt som externt.
* Bevisad förmåga att leverera lönsam tillväxt och andelsvinst inom impulsdrivna FMCG-kategorier (så som dryck, snacks eller glass).
* Du besitter god analytisk förmåga och vana att arbeta med P&L, ROI-modeller och prognosverktyg.


 Red Bull Sweden AB är en arbetsgivare som arbetar för lika möjligheter oavsett vem du är. Vi tror starkt på att olikheter och månfald är viktigt för vår fortsatta framgång. Besluten vi tar i våra rekryteringsprocesser baserar vi på dina erfarenheter och färdigheter och vi välkomnar alla ansökningar som representerar vårt samhälle, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionshinder, sexuell läggning, etnicitet, religion.

title: Embedded Android Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Embedded Systems
* Linux
* Image recognition
* R&D
* Optics
* Mechanics
* Android SDK
* Android Applications
* Android HAL
* Android drivers
* Android BSP
* Android tools (IDE )
* RTOS (FreeRTOS , VxWorks, Linux RT)
* C programming language
* C++
* C#
* CMake
* Python
* Ansible
* LCD
* Wi-Fi Bluetooth
* Cameras and camera sensors (MIPI)
* Video pipeline 4
* Video for liinux (V4L)
* Git
* Jenkins
* Yocto
* English fluent


**Application deadline:** 
 31-10-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Experienced Embedded Software Application Engineer at Volvo Energy
description:
*Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.*

  

With new technologies and business models increasing in importance at high speed, the transportation and infrastructure industries are changing more and at higher pace than ever before. As the Volvo Group, we are accelerating to drive our industry forward also in these important areas. Do you want to join our journey and shape tomorrow’s society together with us?

 **Working at Volvo Energy is different**  

Welcome to a team unified by an important mission, great ideas, fun, diversity and inclusiveness. Our colleagues are - and will always be - the most important part of the story. Each colleague truly matters and plays an important role in our journey. Consequently, while demands are high, there are also plenty of opportunities to learn and grow - as a professional and as a person.

  

We will be a relatively small team and therefore look for colleagues that thoroughly enjoy this intrapreneurial challenge and ready to hit the ground running. We value individuals who lead with passion, perform with purpose, and transform with vision. Moreover, it will be essential you have a strong ability to form trustful relationships to effectively work with partners - inside and outside of the Volvo Group – in a cross-functional manner. You will make a difference!

 **Making it a success for yourself and Volvo Energy**  

You welcome this chance to work in a smart and modern way, where we together are the catalysts to make our desired future happen. As our business area is new, you need to share our curiosity for new technologies, tools and ways-of-working and constantly want to take it to the next level. At the same time, you realize that breaking new ground also means mistakes will happen and nothing will be perfect. These are not frustrations but instead learning opportunities for us. You see the journey itself as the destination and whilst you are highly successful in your current position, you feel a strong desire to move further – you want to move from success to significance.

 **Being part of Battery Optimization and Monitoring - Technology**  

Battery Energy Storage System – Technology is a function within Volvo Energy that develops and industrializes Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) and associated services. In this function, we work with new batteries as well as second life applications with vehicle battery packs, monitoring and data analytics, and battery safety.

  

Working in very close cooperation with our colleagues from Volvo Group and especially Group Trucks Technology, Group Trucks Purchasing and Group Trucks Operations, we create new business offer opportunities as well as value propositions.

 **What are we looking for in this specific role?**  

We are seeking a motivated Embedded Software Developer with a foundational understanding of system design and development, preferably within the energy storage or industrial automation sectors. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn and grow, focusing on developing our local EMS software for our product range. If you enjoy working in a collaborative team environment and are ready to take on a hands-on role, you could be the perfect fit for our team!

 **Your starting point will be to:**

* Perform functional development, meaning requirement breakdown, software design documentation, implementation, testing and verification.
* Lead system engineering in a technical team and play an active role in delivery.
* Responsibility for securing quality and readiness before released.
* Support the design, configuration, integration and implementation of process control solutions for our BESS products.
* Support in developing software and hardware design specifications, and purchasing PLC, drives and other electrical components and equipment.
* Take part in installing, test, and start-up control systems in testing rigs, prototypes, and final builds.

  

  

**What are the qualifications likely required to be successful?**

* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, electronic system design, or a related field.
* At least 2 years of experience in embedded software development and system within energy storage or industrial automation
* Knowledge of process instrumentation and control systems. It’s a big plus if you have experience working with grid connected energy storage systems.
* Experience designing and programming control systems with emphasis on PLCs, SCADA or HMI systems.
* Skilled in Python programming, Automation Engineering, IoT, Mathworks, and Git
* Strong communication and presentation skills, self-organized, with excellent problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment.

 **So you want to apply?**  

If our entrepreneurial spirit, adaptability, and customer-focused mindset light your inner fire, we might be a great match!

  

In addition to your application and CV, I look forward to reading your cover letter and getting to know what makes you the perfect fit for this role!

 **Feel free to contact me if you have further questions**  

Roeland Bisschop, Head of Product Development, e-mail: roeland.bisschop@volvo.com

 **Last application date:** 9th November


We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as we’ll be reviewing applications continuously.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Volvo Energy** lives and leads the change in accelerating Volvo Group’s electrification journey and driving circularity for a better tomorrow. We bring together people with who will work in a highly diverse, equal and inclusive global context with an entrepreneurial spirit where everyone is key and directly contributes to achieving our ambitions for wanted position: better for people – better for planet – better for business. Together – from individual success to collective significance!
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Lindab Ventilation AB söker Produktägare CAD-verktyg
description:
Om tjänsten
  
  

Som Produktägare CAD-verktyg blir du en nyckelperson i utvecklingen av våra digitala verktyg för ventilationsdesign. Du ansvarar för att våra CAD-lösningar som används av ingenjörer, konsulter och partners möter kundernas behov, håller hög kvalitet och bidrar till företagets affärsmål.
  
  

Du kommer att arbeta nära våra utvecklingsteam, kunder, säljorganisationer, R&D och andra produktägare för att driva förbättringar, planera funktionalitet och säkra att våra verktyg fungerar sömlöst med MagiCAD, LindQST och andra plattformar.
  
  

Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter & ansvarsområden
  
  

* Äga och driva produktvisionen för CAD-området inom ventilation och strategi för applikationsportföljen.
* Fånga in och översätta kundbehov till tydliga krav och user stories.
* Samarbeta med interna och externa intressenter t.ex. MagiCAD Group, produktchefer, försäljning och support.
* Säkerställa hög datakvalitet i modeller, metadata, integrationer med Lindabs övriga tjänster och produkter.
* Analysera användardata, trender och feedback för att styra produktens utveckling.
* Prioritera och hantera produktens backlog i samarbete med utvecklingsteamet.
* Bidra till roadmap, releaseplanering och dokumentation.
* Följa upp leveranser och säkerställa att produkten levererar värde till användarna.


Din bakgrund
  
  

* Högskole-/universitetsexamen inom relevant område.
* Mycket god förståelse för CAD-miljöer, med egen erfarenhet av att använda t ex MagiCAD, AutoCAD, Revit eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet inom bygg- eller ventilationsbranschen, vilket är ett krav.
* Erfarenhet av att översätta tekniska lösningar till affärsvärde.


Dina personliga egenskaper
  
  

För att trivas och lyckas i rollen som produktägare för CAD-verktyg ser vi att du har en kombination av tekniskt intresse, affärsförståelse och god samarbetsförmåga. Då vi verkar inom en internationell koncern behärskar du utöver svenska språket även engelska i tal och skrift.
  
  

Du är analytisk, strukturerad och kvalitetsmedveten, med förmåga att se både helheten och detaljerna i komplexa system. Du har ett strategiskt tänk och kan omsätta verksamhetens behov till tydliga krav och prioriteringar.
  
  

Som person är du kommunikativ och relationsskapande. Du har lätt att skapa förtroende och motivera andra genom ett tydligt och engagerat ledarskap.
  
  

Du är proaktiv och drivande, tar initiativ till förbättringar och ser till att de blir genomförda. Med din flexibilitet och problemlösningsförmåga hanterar du förändringar på ett konstruktivt sätt och bidrar till att driva verksamheten framåt.
  
  

Vårt erbjudande
  
  

Vi erbjuder dig en roll på ett marknadsledande företag med goda arbetsvillkor och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter. Vår företagskultur kännetecknas av hållbarhet, prestigelöshet och kreativitet. Vi är en arbetsplats med fokus på omtanke och hållbarhet – en arbetsplats du ska kunna känna stolthet över att arbeta på!
  
  

Övrig information
  
**Plats:** Grevie (flexibelt)
  
**Lön:** Enligt överenskommelse
  
  

**Omfattning:** Heltid
  
  

**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidareanställning
  
  

Vill du veta mer om tjänsten
  
Kontakta Dan Kristiansson, Manager Customer Software Solutions, Lindab Ventilation AB e-post: dan.kristiansson@lindab.com Telefon: 0431 - 852 04
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Vi arbetar med löpande urval, sista ansökningsdag är dock senast 2025-11-16.
  
  

Lindab Group är en ledande europeisk ventilationskoncern som består av företag som utvecklar, tillverkar, marknadsför och distribuerar högkvalitativa produkter och system för energieffektiv ventilation, hälsosam inomhusluft och hållbara byggnader. Vi strävar efter att vara den mest attraktiva arbetsgivaren i branschen med ansvarsfulla värderingar vad gäller klimat, innovation och mångfald.
  
  

Som anställd kommer du att möta ett utvecklingsfokuserat företag med en tydlig vision men också en lång historia och en stark grund som bygger på våra tre kärnvärden; kundframgång, ordning och reda samt jordnära. Detta gör Lindab Group till en arbetsplats där medarbetarna är stolta över sitt arbete och har en fin kollegial gemenskap som kännetecknas av tillit och respekt.
  
  

Vi finns representerade i ett 20-tal länder och har cirka 5 000 medarbetare fördelade på runt 200 platser i Europa.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**What we should tell you about the company:**


Filed is building the **first AI tax preparer** trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.


In just 9 months, we’ve hit **strong product-market fit**, are generating insanely **fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue**, and are **backed by top-tier investors**. We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say **“I was there when it all started.”**


https://techcrunch.com/2025/05/21/filed-raises-17m-to-automate-the-drudgery-of-tax-prep/


⸻

**What we should tell you about the role:**


We’re looking for a full-stack engineer who moves fast and thrives in high-velocity environments. You’re the kind of person who sees a broken workflow, understands the root cause quickly, and ships a fix in hours—not weeks. You love turning ambiguity into working software, and you don’t wait around for perfect specs to start building.


You’re a generalist who’s just as comfortable spinning up a backend service as you are crafting a clean, responsive UI. You sweat the details, but never let them block progress. You think in terms of speed, value, and iteration—always asking: how can we get this in front of users faster?


As one of our earliest engineers, you’ll help shape the core product and infrastructure. You’ll work closely with design, ML, and actual tax pros to reinvent how this industry works—by shipping fast, learning fast, and doing what others said couldn’t be done.


Our product and engineering team is based in **Stockholm**. We’re prioritising local candidates, but will **consider candidates from elsewhere in the EU, who can travel to Stockholm.**


⸻

**Here’s why this is a terrible job:**

* This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.
* We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we’re going in the right direction.
* If you need a few extra days to perfect your code, chances are there’s already a handful of team members blocked behind you.
* We use tools like Cursor to move fast, test ideas in days, and ship extremely fast.
* You’ll be operating at the intersection of product logic, machine learning, user psychology, and highly regulated workflows.
* There are no clear answers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and constant input from every direction.
* You’ll ask yourself, is this really the work? It is. And it’s not for everyone.


⸻

**Here's why it's the best career choice you'll make:**

* We’re building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.
* We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.
* You’ll be paid above market. You’ll earn equity that grows fast. And you’ll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.
* You’ll ship code because you believe in it, not because it got signed off.
* You’ll talk to customers weekly. You’ll drive outcomes end to end.
* We’ll tell you what needs to be achieved. How you get there is on you.
* We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so dialed in that you can predict exactly what your user needs before you ever talk to them.
* That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.


⸻

**The teammate we're looking for:**

* Thrives at solving complex, technical product problems
* Moves seamlessly between systems thinking and detailed execution
* Excited by the challenge of serving multiple user groups and workflows
* No lone wolves — we need a collaborative engineer
* Big bonus if you have a track record of owning product outcomes, not just tasks


⸻

**What you’ll be responsible for:**

* Architecting and building complex workflows across the full stack
* Co-owning the entire product experience from backend to frontend
* Driving product direction through technical execution and intuition
* Becoming an Oracle with a best-in-class customer model in your head


⸻

**Your hard skillset:**

* Deep experience across backend and frontend systems
* Fluency in TypeScript, Python, or similar modern stacks
* Comfortable with infra, APIs, databases, and debugging messy edge cases
* Bonus if you’ve used AI tools to accelerate development
* Even bigger bonus if you’ve worked in regulated or high-trust domains


⸻

**Your soft skillset:**

* Comfortable being uncomfortable and making calls with incomplete data
* Empathetic and curious — building for the user, not just for elegance
* Highly collaborative across product, design, and customer support
* Detail-oriented but pragmatic — you know when polish matters and when to move
* You own your work and welcome the accountability that comes with it


⸻

**Growth and Levels:**


We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.


We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.


This isn’t a comfy engineering role. It’s fast, focused, and customer-obsessed.


You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.


⸻

**The process:**

* Quick intro call (30 minutes)
* Code walkthrough and async task (60 minutes)
* Final round with our team (120 minutes)


In just 3.5 hours, you’ll be wanting early access, just like the rest of our team—to dive into the codebase and help build a generational company, even before you start as you'll be able to see the opportunity to transform your career.


Compensation Range: $66K - $143K

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer - Hardware Area
description:
**Application Deadline:** Jan. 31, 2026 Linköping Hybrid
  
  

We are now looking for a Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our Hardware Area in Linköping.
  
  

While ACTIA Nordics roots are in the automotive industry, we now support clients across a variety of industries, where we offer in-house innovative development collaborations for our customers. Just as important as innovation is our responsibility to the planet. Sustainability is not just a checkbox for us – it is a crucial part of who we are. Our vision is to make the World Green, Safe and Connected. That means, for a hardware engineer, actively choosing components with lower environmental impact and continuously seeking to reduce Scope 3 emissions throughout our supply chain and product lifecycle. With other words – designing smart and robust products that emits low emissions.
  
  

As a Mechanical Engineer at ACTIA Nordic, you will have a broad and hands-on role where you’ll take on significant technical responsibility, work closely with other disciplines, and be involved from concept to final product.
  
  

You’ll be one out of two mechanical engineers in the team, which gives you a central role in development while collaborating closely with electronics engineers, testers, and other colleagues.
  
  

**Your key responsibilities will therefore be:**  

To drive the mechanical development for new products – from concept to production.
  
Work broadly across CAD design, manufacturing method selection, and product structure.
  
Build and maintain BOMs (Bill of Materials) and ensure solid documentation.
  
Maintain close dialogue with testers and follow up on product verification.
  
Collaborate closely with electronics engineers to ensure integrated solutions.
  
Ensure that the design is cost-effective and manufacturable.
  
Arvid Trygg
  
Software Development Engineer
  
"At ACTIA, you are never stuck alone with a problem. Everybody wants to help you succeed in your work. That is for me a huge advantage when it comes to developing the best solutions"
  
Kais Trabelsi
  
SW Line Manager
  
"Here, you have the opportunity to influence all decisions made. We are close to the management, you can express your opinions freely and it is a workplace culture with friendly, respectful colleagues."
  
Skills & Requirements
  
  

**We are looking for someone who has:**  

A university degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
  
5+ years of experience in mechanical design, preferably within the automotive industry or related sectors.
  
Strong knowledge of manufacturing methods and production technologies – especially for electronics-related products.
  
An understanding of product structure and experience building and managing BOMs.
  
Proficiency in Catia V5 – this is our main CAD tool.
  
The ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team.
  
Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English.
  
  

**It's a plus if you have:**  

Experience from the manufacturing of electronics products.
  
Previous work in projects where mechanical and electronic design are closely integrated.
  
Practical understanding of testing, verification, and production processes.
  
  

Full-spectrum development. From SW to HW
  
  

In-house production. Full insight and control
  
  

Workplace flexibility. Hybrid work set-up
  
  

High-profile clients – global well-known brands
  
  

Company health care and health insurance
  
  

Flat organization. Collaborate and innovate freely
  
  

About the company
  
  

Welcome to the technology leader in connectivity
  
ACTIA’s products are used in millions of applications worldwide, mainly in the automotive industry. We are a part of the global ACTIA Group, but our workplace culture is characterized by the closeness, innovativeness and flexibility of a smaller company. As an employee at ACTIA, you have the opportunity to work with world-leading technology in the entire chain from software, to hardware, production and ancillary services. It provides a valuable and exciting overall perspective where you can see every technical detail develop together with your colleagues. We are looking for everybody who is attracted by challenging, forefront technology, and who have high expectations for both your own and your workplace's development.
  
  

Our Core Values
  
  

Care
  
The wellbeing of people and environment is important to us and we make long-term sustainable choices.
  
  

Courage
  
We empower each other and seek opportunities to develop both individuals and as a company.
  
  

Dedication
  
We take a genuine interest in our client’s business and strive for excellence together.
  
  

Trust
  
We create safe and efficient technology that both our customers and society can rely on.
  
  

Oscar Bentevik Holm | Contact Person
  
  

Graphic rendering with WebGL2 has been disabled or is not supported by your graphic card. The map cannot be displayed.
  
+
  
  

ACTIA Nordic AB
  
  

Linköping | Hybrid
